title: Ride1Up launches two new electric bicycles, dropping price and boosting power
short_description: The San Diego-based e-bike company Ride1Up has just announced two new models of electric bicycles. The new Ride1Up Core-5 returns a sub-$1k e-bike to the company’s lineup, while the Ride1Up LMT’D offers the highest torque e-bike yet from Ride1Up.

title: LA coalition proposes $150 billion in nationwide stimulus for vehicle electrification
short_description: The LA-based public-private Transportation Electrification Partnership is proposing a nationwide $150 billion plan to support zero-emissions vehicles. The proposal was sent last week to House and Senate leadership, including House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, and Minority Leader Chuck Schumer.

title: Tesla delays return of Fremont factory workers amid shutdown extension
short_description: Tesla is delaying the return of its Fremont factory workers as it is going to extend its factory shutdown due to an extension of the shelter-in-place order in the Bay Area.

title: BMW iX3 electric SUV: Are these leaked pictures of the production version?
short_description: Alleged pictures of the production version of the BMW iX3 electric SUV have leaked ahead of the start of production.

title: Exclusive: Ford plans contactless test drives of electric Mustang Mach-E
short_description: Ford will soon convert reservations for the all-electric Mustang Mach-E into official orders. Mark Kaufman, the vehicle’s global director of marketing distribution, told Electrek that test drives will be critical for a successful launch of Ford’s electric crossover. Therefore, the company is beginning to plan how to get prospective buyers behind the wheel, even if pandemic-related physical distancing orders are still in place.

title: Elon Musk: Tesla Cybertruck glass demo fail helped electric truck get attention
short_description: Elon Musk agreed with the suspicion many had about the Tesla Cybertruck gaining a lot of exposure thanks to its failed glass strenght demonstration.

title: The story of how one guy got all of Boosted’s leftover electric skateboards after its bankruptcy
short_description: Boosted was known as the leader in premium electric skateboards, and even expanded into high end (and high power) electric scooters. Thus, news of the company’s bankruptcy and demise came as a shock to their large customer base and to many in the industry. But now in a strange twist to the Boosted saga, one man has wound up with essentially all of Boosted’s remaining electric skateboard and replacement parts inventory. And he wants to keep the good times rolling.

title: Tesla calls some Fremont employees back to work before health orders are lifted
short_description: Bloomberg reports this afternoon that Tesla is calling some workers back to its US assembly plant in Fremont starting next week. The move to get workers back to work would be before Bay Area stay-home orders are lifted. The region’s health orders are in effect until at least May 3, but Tesla staff working in paint and stamping operations was called back for April 29.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 25, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.25.20.mp3

title: Tesla to give update on new Roadster and electric semi truck later this year
short_description: Elon Musk says that Tesla “probably can” give an update on new Roadster and Tesla Semi electric truck later this year.

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: How did US politicians recognize Earth Day (or not)?
short_description: How did high-profile US politicians acknowledge Earth Day? Their responses are telling. The Florida Aquarium has reproduced coral, which may save the world’s third-largest coral reef. Climate change undercuts improvements in air quality, says the American Lung Association. And more…

title: Elon Musk: Tesla Cybertruck Gigafactory needs to be more than halfway to east coast
short_description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk added some comments about the automaker’s plan for a ‘Cybertruck Gigafactory’ to manufacture its upcoming electric pickup truck in the central US.

title: EV charging-station providers prepare for supersized electric vehicles and greater accessibility
short_description: BC Hydro, a utility actively supporting EV infrastructure, is thinking about how its charging station can accommodate trailer-towing electric SUVs and trucks, as well as disabled drivers.

title: Tesla releases new, highly anticipated Traffic Light and Stop Sign Control feature
short_description: Tesla has released a new, highly anticipated Traffic Light and Stop Sign Control feature.As we reported last month, Tesla has started to push an Autopilot update with the actual ability to handle intersections to some drivers in its “early access fleet,” a group of owners who beta test new software update from Tesla.

title: Environmentalists demand that Michael Moore’s anti-EV film be retracted
short_description: On Earth Day, a documentary entitled “Planet of the Humans” appeared on Michael Moore’s YouTube channel. You might expect a film from the acclaimed rabble-rousing film director, who served as executive producer, to champion the cause of clean-energy technology and electric vehicles. Instead, the movie characterizes solar and wind as a sell-out to corporate America. And EVs are just a means for utility companies to burn more coal.

title: Podcast: Tesla Model S/X Performance update, Tesla Autopilot, Nikola Motors, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including a Tesla Model S/X Performance update, Tesla Autopilot update, Nikola Motors going after Tesla, and more.

title: Tesla Model Y teardown reveals beautiful mega casting manufacturing breakthrough
short_description: The Tesla Model Y teardown is starting to reveal the beautiful mega casting on the rear of the electric SUV, which could be a great manufacturing breakthrough.

title: Porsche voluntarily lowered Taycan’s official range numbers from 200 to 192 miles
short_description: The release of the Porsche Taycan’s range numbers in January landed with a thud. It was taken as a sign of inferiority that Porsche’s 93.4kWh battery yielded only 201 and 192 miles for the Turbo and Turbo S version, respectively. But EPA data now reveals that the company voluntarily lowered the range numbers.

title: EGEB: US’ Permian Basin releases ‘highest emissions ever measured’ from oil and gas
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):US Permian Basin releases methane at twice the average rate of 11 other US oil and gas regions.The US Supreme Court rules that the Clean Water Act covers groundwater pollution in Maui.Solar photovoltaic interventions have reduced rural poverty in China, says new study.

title: US Supreme Court rules Clean Water Act covers groundwater pollution in Maui
short_description: The Supreme Court yesterday, in a 6-3 ruling on the Maui/Clean Water Act Case, held that discharges to “waters of the United States” (WOTUS) via groundwater are covered under the Clean Water Act “when there is a functional equivalent of a direct discharge.” The federal government must regulate groundwater pollutants that make their way into navigable waters such as oceans.

title: Ford might delay Mustang Mach-E launch, will update as production restarts
short_description: Ford might delay the Mustang Mach-E launch amid the coronavirus pandemic and will give an updated timeline as it restarts its production facilities.

title: Tesla patents a new electrode for its 1-million-mile battery
short_description: Tesla patents a new NCA electrode that is likely going to be used in its new battery cell built in-house, which is expected to be longer-lasting and cheaper.

title: Xiaomi’s cheap electric bikes are getting better with new $350 and 50-mile rear suspension e-bike
short_description: Xiaomi’s Youpin crowdfunding platform has been used to launch a number of affordable electric bicycles over the last few years. And with each new model the bikes seem to become increasingly attention-grabbing. Take for example the new Himo Z16 electric bicycle just unveiled for US$352.

title: Tesla appoints former head of Japan’s Government Pension Investment Fund to its board
short_description: Tesla appoints Hiromichi (Hiro) Mizuno, Japan’s Government Pension Investment Fund former head, to the board of directors.

title: The military develops plan to use EVs similar to Tesla Semi for remote missions
short_description: Lt. General Eric Wesley, head of the US Army’s Futures and Concepts Center, is working on a detailed white paper for the military use of EVs. That will serve as a recommendation for how the Army transitions from internal combustion to electric vehicles. Wesley is inspired by the development of large battery-powered trucks by Tesla and others.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 23, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.23.20.mp3

title: Work on Goodenough’s breakthrough solid-state EV battery moves forward
short_description: John Goodenough, the co-inventor of the lithium-ion battery, won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2019. But two years earlier, he announced that he made a breakthrough on a solid-state battery that could mean the end of internal-combustion cars. Goodenough, now 97, is self-isolating from the coronavirus and working on Nobel-related commitments. But the job of commercializing the potential breakthrough is being carried forward by the public utility Hydro-Québec.

title: Elon Musk hypes up Tesla smart home HVAC, hints at Cybertruck feature
short_description: Elon Musk seems to be really interested in Tesla expanding into the home HVAC industry — going as far as saying that he is “dying to do it.”

title: All-electric Polestar 2’s starting price is set at $60,000
short_description: Polestar today announced the formal pricing of its first pure electric car, the 2021 Polestar 2. The performance-oriented fastback has an MSRP of $59,900 in the United States. Destination charges will send the entry price of the Polestar 2 above $60,000.

title: China’s new EV subsidies disqualify luxury models from Tesla, BMW, and Daimler
short_description: China announced today that it cut subsidies for electric cars by 10% this year, followed by further reductions in the next two years. The reduced subsidies are now only available to passenger cars costing less than 300,000 yuan ($42,400). Tesla’s China-made Model 3 sedan is currently priced at 323,800 ($45,800).

title: EGEB: US power demand falls to 2003 low due to coronavirus shutdown
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):US electricity demand fell to a near 17-year low last week due to the pandemic shutdown.The UK’s and Germany’s solar panels have just produced record amounts of electricity.It’s not all doom and gloom: 8minute Solar Energy expands development pipeline to 18 GW.

title: This little electric crossover starts at just $9,778, but guess where it’s available
short_description: You guessed it: China. The Chinese market has a lot more options than the US when it comes to electric vehicles and infinitely more options when it comes to cheap electric cars at less than $15,000.The new Maple 30x electric crossover starting at $9,778 is the latest in that category.

title: Germany, UK produce record solar power amid smog-free skies
short_description: Germany’s photovoltaic plants produced 32.227 GW on Monday (40% of the country’s power), which beat the country’s previous record on March 23. The UK broke its solar record on Monday at 9.68 GW. The previous record was 9.55 GW in May 2019.

title: Tesla claims 3x improved thermal endurance in Model S/X performance update
short_description: Tesla claims a 3x improvement in thermal endurance for Model S and Model X performance vehicles in a new software update.

title: Juiced shows off 30 mph performance of the 2kW HyperScorpion electric moped
short_description: The Juiced Scorpion has been one of the most highly anticipated electric moped-style bikes of the season. And while the standard Juiced Scorpion has already begun making deliveries, the higher powered HyperScorpion has eluded pre-order holders for now.

title: Ford unveils Electric Mustang Cobra Jet 1400, will ‘crush 1/4 mile in ~8 sec’
short_description: Ford is today unveiling the Electric Mustang Cobra Jet 1400, a one-off performance electric vehicle that they believe will “crush the quarter-mile in just 8 seconds.”

title: Juiced shows off 30 MPH performance of the 2 kW HyperScorpion electric moped
short_description: The Juiced Scorpion has been one of the most highly anticipated electric moped-style bikes of the season. And while the standard Juiced Scorpion has already begun making deliveries, the higher powered HyperScorpion has eluded pre-order holders for now.

title: Ford unveils Electric Mustang Cobra Jet 1400, will ‘crush 1/4 mile in ~8-sec’
short_description: Ford is unveiling today the Electric Mustang Cobra Jet 1400, a one-off performance electric vehicle that they believe will “crush the quarter-mile in just 8 seconds.”

title: Volvo cuts R&D and design tweaks but will leave EV budget intact
short_description: The economic downturn due to the pandemic is causing automakers to delay launches and slash R&D projects. Volvo’s CEO Hakan Samuelsson said that his company, like others, is searching for where to cut budgets. But expenses related to the company’s efforts on EVs, as well as self-driving tech, will not be touched.

title: Investors bet on Tesla (TSLA) instead of GM and Toyota to lead auto technology
short_description: Investors would bet on Tesla instead of GM and Toyota to lead the auto industry’s technology transition to electric and autonomous vehicles.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 22, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.22.20.mp3

title: Study of 3,900 electric cars: How the Tesla Model 3 transformed EV charging habits
short_description: The Tesla Model 3 didn’t go on sale until halfway through 2017. But in less than three years, the Model 3 has radically shifted how and when EV drivers charge their cars. That comes through loud and clear when comparing the charging patterns of EVs in 2014 and 2019. FleetCarma, which helps utilities understand and manage EV charging, today published data based on a new study of 3,900 electric vehicles.

title: Tesla Semi design lawsuit moves forward, Nikola Motors keeps looking weaker
short_description: Nikola Motors’ lawsuit over the Tesla Semi design lawsuit is moving forward after their design patents have been upheld despite looking quite weak.

title: Sweden becomes the third European country to close its last coal power plant
short_description: Just days after Austria shut its last coal power plant, Sweden has followed suit with the closure of Stockholm Exergi AB’s Värtaverket plant, two years ahead of schedule.

title: Elon Musk: Tesla Cybertruck will end up smaller – but retain most of its large cabin
short_description: While Tesla Cybertruck’s production version will be smaller than the prototype unveiled last year, CEO Elon Musk assures potential buyers that it retain most of its large cabin space.

title: Daimler ends hydrogen car development because it’s too costly
short_description: Daimler’s Mercedes-Benz is killing its program to develop passenger cars powered by hydrogen fuel cells. The company has been working on fuel-cell vehicles for more than 30 years — chasing the dream of a zero-emissions car that has a long driving range, three-minute fill-ups, and emits only water vapor. In the end, the company conceded that building hydrogen cars was too costly, about double the expense of an equivalent battery-electric vehicle.

title: EGEB: Earth Day turns 50 and thoughts from founder, Denis Hayes. What’s changed?
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Earth Day founder Denis Hayes: “I hope in 2070 we will be in a position to celebrate.”deVere Group CEO Nigel Green explains the oil futures crash (and why he wouldn’t invest in it).Sweden has become the third European country to close its last coal power plant.

title: Tesla drops a bunch of new Autopilot data, 3 billion miles and more
short_description: Tesla’s head of AI, Andrej Karpathy, released a bunch of new data about Autopilot and its features in a new presentation.

title: This Earth Day, here are 10 reasons to swap your car for an electric bike or scooter
short_description: Today is Earth Day, which makes it a great day to reflect on how we can all reduce our individual impact on the environment. Transportation is a massive contributor to climate change, and a particularly effective and fun alternative to single-occupant car trips is a personal electric vehicle like an electric bicycle, e-scooter or other small electric vehicle platforms.Cars are often used as a default form of transportation, even when a multi-thousand pound vehicle isn’t always necessary. Electric cars are certainly an eco-improvement over gas-powered cars, but they still use as much as 10-20x the energy of micromobility alternatives like a personal electric vehicle. By swapping many car trips for personal mobility alternatives, you can vastly reduce your daily energy usage in a meaningful way.

title: Tesla releases impressive videos of cars avoiding running over pedestrians
short_description: Tesla has released a few impressive videos of its Autopilot-powered emergency braking feature helping to avoid running over inattentive pedestrians.What might be even more impressive is that the automaker says that it sees those events happen every day.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 21, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.21.20.mp3

title: Drive Electric Earth Day goes virtual with an EV livestream tomorrow
short_description: In the face of the coronavirus pandemic, Plug in America, the Sierra Club, and the Electric Auto Association are hosting a livestream version of their annual Drive Electric Earth Day event tomorrow.  The event will consist of informational speakers, live entertainment, and more. Celebrity guests include race car driver and EV advocate Leilani Münter and the Wall Street Journal‘s automotive columnist Dan Neil.The livestream will start tomorrow, April 22, Earth Day, at 2 p.m. EDT/11 a.m. PDT on Facebook Live.  A Facebook account is not required to view the stream.

title: Lordstown Motors’ plan for $52,000 electric pickup truck slips to next year
short_description: Lordstown Motors, an electric vehicle startup, is pushing its plan to deliver a $52,500 electric pickup truck to next year due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Exclusive: Byton furloughs hundreds of workers with unknown impact on production timeline
short_description: The downturn in the economy due to the pandemic is wreaking havoc with the auto industry. The impacts are particularly hard on start-ups trying to launch their first vehicles. Byton, the Chinese EV-maker, this week put hundreds of employees from its Santa Clara facility on furlough, following earlier reductions in China.

title: Hey EV drivers: Trump is getting ready to bail out big oil
short_description: For weeks, we’ve been hearing that plummeting oil prices and dirt-cheap gasoline will kill electric vehicles. Now it appears the oil industry is the one whose future is in question. So, of course, President Trump is plotting a big bailout for Big Oil.

title: Tesla Model 3 fleet is delivered to Thai police who turns them into patrol cars
short_description: Tesla delivered a whole fleet of Model 3 electric cars to the Thai police who turned them into police patrol cars.

title: EGEB: Norway supreme court to hear landmark Arctic oil exploration case
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Greenpeace and other environmental groups are taking Norway to court over oil exploration.We can’t test-drive EVs right now, but you can virtually test-drive a Tesla 3. Here’s how.Samsung designs new eco-friendly electronic packaging for its Lifestyle TV product portfolio.

title: Tesla updates Model S Performance 0-60 mph acceleration to 2.3 seconds
short_description: Tesla has updated its Model S Performance, its flagship electric sedan, to advertise a 0 to 60 mph acceleration in just 2.3 seconds.

title: VanMoof unveils next generation e-bikes with better specs, lower prices
short_description: VanMoof’s electric bicycles have a well-deserved reputation for quality and aesthetics — so much so that the design and even the shipping boxes have been imitated by e-bike companies around the world. But to stay one step ahead of the imitators, VanMoof has now announced its next generation Vanmoof S3 and X3 e-bikes. And things have just gotten even better.

title: Lucid shares winter testing video of upcoming Air sedan
short_description: Lucid Motors has released a video of their upcoming Lucid Air sedan doing winter testing in harsh conditions in Minnesota.

title: Tesla could use factory shutdown to update Model S and Model X interior
short_description: Tesla might take advantage of its current factory shutdown to update the Model S and Model X interior and avoid the usual headaches that come with Tesla updating its vehicles.

title: German carmakers and politicians call for ‘eco-scrappage’ plan to boost sales of green cars
short_description: Germany reopened car dealerships today, but it could be a struggle to convince consumers to buy a new car. So the country’s top auto executives and politicians are calling for an eco-scrappage plan to spur sales of EVs and other efficient vehicles. Auto executives, government officials, labor, and environmentalists all agree on the need for the program.

title: US oil futures crash below $0 for first time in history — how’d that happen?
short_description: US oil futures plummeted below zero today due to the coronavirus pandemic. Loss of demand has pushed domestic storage tanks toward capacity.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 20, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.20.20.mp3

title: Xpeng’s Tesla clone sedan launches this month, with promise of Level 3 autonomy
short_description: Xpeng Motors announced that its P7 “smart electric sports sedan” officially rolls out in China on April 27. The Tesla-looking sedan already made big promises for range: 435 miles of range on the NEDC cycle. Now the company says the P7 will use Nvidia technology to enable Level 3 autonomy for highways, city streets, and valet parking.

title: Electric SUV startup tries to collect $140,000 deposits with dubious 700-mile range claim
short_description: A new electric vehicle startup based in New Jersey has been making the news after claiming to have a large electric SUV with 700 miles of range, for which they are trying to collect $140,000 deposits, but we are extremely skeptical of the effort here at Electrek.

title: All-electric Subaru Evoltis, with oddball design, to be unveiled in 2021
short_description: In a Tokyo press conference in January 2020, Subaru showed the first design study for a pure-electric crossover to be developed with Toyota. At the time, Auto News said it wasn’t going into production until 2025. New reports from Japan now peg an unveiling for 2021 while confirming the name of the vehicle as “Evoltis.”

title: Short-term pain for green jobs, but there could be long-term gain
short_description: The US lost more than 100,000 green energy jobs in March due to the coronavirus shutdown, but the International Renewable Energy Agency’s (IRENA) first Global Renewables Outlook, released today, reports that if the world thinks long term, investment in green energy would be a huge boost to the global economy.

title: Here’s what Ford’s electric SUV based on VW’s MEB platform might look like
short_description: Ford is working on an electric vehicle based on VW’s MEB platform, and now we might have an idea of what it looks like, thanks to a new German report.

title: Kawasaki’s upcoming electric motorcycle gets an official name, and we get a fresh look
short_description: Kawasaki first announced its official intentions to develop a Kawasaki electric motorcycle last year during the 2019 EICMA Milan Motorcycle Show. We were in attendance and had the chance to see the original prototype in person.

title: EGEB: Wind is now the largest source of electricity in Iowa and Kansas
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Wind is now the largest source of electricity in the Midwestern states of Iowa and Kansas.Austria shuts down its last coal power plant.Air pollution dropped radically in March in cities under coronavirus lockdown.

title: Tesla Cybertruck is going to be ‘able to float for a while,’ says Elon Musk
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck is going to be “able to float for a while,” says CEO Elon Musk, who apparently can’t wait to bring the electric pickup truck to production.

title: E-bike on the cheap? We review a $420 electric bicycle from Amazon
short_description: How good can one of the cheapest electric bicycles on Amazon be? That’s exactly the question I set out to answer when I bought a Spadger folding electric bike for the cool sum of $420 earlier this year. It may not have much in the way of extra features, but it sure does lower the barrier to entry for anyone looking to get their first e-bike on a budget.

title: Fisker unveils off-road version of its ~$30,000 electric SUV
short_description: Fisker, a new electric vehicle startup from the famous car designer Henrik Fisker, has unveiled an off-road version of its $38,000 electric SUV.

title: NIU and partners offer free electric scooter rides to healthcare workers
short_description: At a time when most people should be staying at home to help contain the coronavirus pandemic, healthcare workers need safe transportation options to their hospitals and clinics more than ever. Electric scooter company NIU has stepped up and created the MoveSafely program with its scooter-sharing partners to provide free rides to healthcare workers.

title: Tesla reduces insurance rate amid pandemic — but there’s a catch
short_description: Tesla is telling its insurance clients that it is reducing rates for March and April amid the pandemic, but there’s a catch.

title: Tesla Cybertruck: Here’s what it looks like with Elon Musk’s design changes
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck’s insane design is going to be updated for the production version, and we now get to see what it could look like based on recent comments by Elon Musk.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 18, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.18.20.mp3

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: South Korea to be first in East Asia to set net zero goal
short_description: After its election, South Korea will be the first country in East Asia to pledge to reach net zero.High pressure caused a dramatic melting of Greenland’s ice sheet in the summer of 2019.Don’t want solar panels on your roof? Embed these cool recycled panels in your pavement instead.And more…

title: Tesla to extend free Supercharging miles from referral program amid pandemic
short_description: Tesla is going to extend the expiration of its free Supercharging miles distributed through from referral program during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Podcast: Tesla Cybertruck news, new paint options, Ford EV charging network, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including a bunch of Tesla Cybertruck news, new Tesla advanced paint options, and a possible Ford EV charging network.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Electrek.mp3

title: First peek at VW ID.3 EV owner’s manual reveals cool list of digital features
short_description: A German YouTuber got his hands on a VIN for the upcoming ID.3 electric car and used it to access VW’s online manual. He discovered a set of high-tech features not commonly found on a small, affordable EV. They’re not groundbreaking, but you can see that VW wants to make its EV a high-tech showcase.

title: Review: Electra’s Cafe Moto Go! Smooth ride, in every way
short_description: Electra, a US nationwide brand with representation in local bike stores, specializes in cruiser bikes and the laid-back lifestyle. The Cafe Moto Go! model is their foray into a high-end cafe racer, and it expectedly hits the mark right on. While it’s not the fastest bike out there, it certainly delivers with comfort, quality, and style. With the added benefit of local support and reliable resale value, the bike has a secure place in the local markets, for those willing to spend the extra money for a high-end cruiser.

title: Tesla Cybertruck: Elon Musk reveals ‘biggest change’ to the electric pickup
short_description: Elon Musk has revealed the biggest changes Tesla is making to the Cybertruck production version compared to the prototype electric pickup truck unveiled last year.

title: Dealerships now offering discounts on EVs, but bigger deals for gas guzzlers
short_description: Car shopping has ground to a halt due to pandemic lockdowns. So dealerships across the US are trying to entice car buyers with attractive deals. But the discounts and 0% financing offers are not as compelling for electric cars as they are for gas-consuming vehicles.

title: Tesla completes massive expansion of its ‘world’s biggest battery’
short_description: Tesla and Neoen, the owner of the Tesla Powerpack farm in Australia that has been described as the “world’s biggest battery”, have completed a massive expansion of the big battery system.

title: EGEB: One of the US’ newest, most efficient coal plants has just gone bankrupt
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  West Virginia coal plant Longview Power has just declared bankruptcy. EPA kills mercury pollution rule, putting pregnant women and minorities at risk. Federal judge cancels Keystone XL oil pipeline permit.

title: Tesla’s acquisition of DeepScale starts to pay off with new IP in machine learning
short_description: Tesla’s acquisition of machine-learning startup DeepScale is starting to pay off, with the team hired through the acquisition starting to deliver new IP for the automaker.

title: The less pricey but still incredible Porsche Taycan 4S EV hits US dealerships
short_description: By now, you probably know about the extraordinary capabilities of the Porsche Taycan electric car. Today, it becomes available at a price of about $50,000 below the previously available versions  — as the Taycan 4S officially arrives at US dealerships.

title: Elon Musk: Tesla Cybertruck will have updated dynamic suspension to ‘kick butt’ in Baja
short_description: Elon Musk announced that Tesla is working on an updated dynamic suspension for the Cybertruck electric pickup truck. He hinted at Tesla could be testing it in Baja off-road Motorsport.

title: EPA kills mercury pollution rule, putting pregnant women, minorities at risk
short_description: The US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced today that it is not “appropriate and necessary” to regulate emissions of mercury and other hazardous air pollutants from coal- and oil-fired power plants.

title: New poll: GM’s opposition to clean car standards is hurting sales
short_description: When the owners of GM vehicles learn about the automaker’s failure to support strong vehicle pollution standards, its reputation goes down and sales suffer. A negative view of GM’s stance on emissions rules was shared by GM customers regardless of party affiliation. That’s the finding of a new poll of 1,000 Chevy, Buick, Cadillac, and GMC owners.

title: The challenge of sustainably producing millions of EV batteries
short_description: Two research institutes at the University of California, Berkeley, today released a research brief about the global supply of batteries for electric vehicles. Many millions of batteries will be needed for EVs in the coming decades. Here’s the overarching question: How can the supply of those batteries meet that demand in a sustainable way?

title: Karma announces plan for 400-mile Revero electric car for 2021
short_description: Karma Automotive, formerly known as Fiske, today announced its plan for its first all-electric vehicle, a new version of the Revero sedan, with up to 400 miles of range scheduled for 2021.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 16, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.16.20.mp3

title: Tesla issues strong ‘Beta’ warning for new traffic light and stop sign feature
short_description: Tesla has expanded the release of its new “Stopping at Traffic Lights and Stop Signs” in the early access program, but it is issuing a strong warning when activating the feature.

title: New BMW 330e plug-in hybrid ups EV range to 23 miles but lowers MPG
short_description: BMW says that its electrification strategy is all about giving consumers the choice of a pure EV or plug-in hybrid. That should put pressure on BMW to push the envelope on all-electric range and overall fuel-efficiency of its plug-in hybrids. But that’s not the case.

title: Federal judge cancels Keystone XL oil pipeline permit
short_description: A US federal judge canceled a key permit on Wednesday for the Keystone XL oil pipeline that’s expected to stretch from Canada to Nebraska.

title: VW focuses its restart effort on electric cars, with urgent need to hit CO2 targets
short_description: Volkswagen is restarting production at its Zwickau plant on April 20, one week ahead of when most of its global factories will resume. The much-anticipated ID.3 EV, the first of a wave of new VW electric vehicles, is produced in Zwickau. The move comes as the company acknowledges new challenges in meeting EU CO2 targets during the pandemic.

title: Tesla releases new feature to charge your car with Powerwall during power outages
short_description: Tesla has released a new Powerwall feature to allow Tesla owners to charge their cars efficiently during power outages using the home battery pack.

title: EGEB: Scientists and the NRDC score a big court win against the EPA
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Federal judge says the EPA can’t bar grant recipients from science advisory panels. Oil giant Shell announces that it will become net zero by 2050. Former US presidential candidate Tom Steyer on why green energy just makes basic market sense.

title: Oil giant Shell announces that it will become net zero by 2050
short_description: The Anglo-Dutch oil giant Royal Dutch Shell has today announced that it intends to reach net zero by 2050 or sooner by selling more green energy to reduce its carbon emissions.

title: Lucid releases new pictures of its EV factory- starting to look like something
short_description: There are not a lot of things more exciting for us at Electrek than seeing more electric car production capacity coming to life and that’s exactly what is happening in Arizona. Lucid released new images of its EV factory in Arizona and it’s starting to look like something.

title: Need low-cost alternative to public transport? Great e-bikes for under $1,200
short_description: The first wave of stimulus checks for up to $1,200 are being distributed by the IRS right now. And believe it or not, $1,200 can actually buy some pretty useful electric bikes for yourself or someone in need. Here are some of the best electric bikes we’ve tested that could be covered by all or part of the $1,200 stimulus check and still leave some cash in your pocket for other essentials.

title: Tesla vehicles are going to drop you off and park themselves later this year, says Musk
short_description: Tesla vehicles are going to be able to drop you off and park themselves later this year, according to a new comment from Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

title: Ford files trademark for EV charging network with dumbest name
short_description: Ford has filed a trademark for the name of an EV charging network and while we like the idea of the possibility for the automaker to build its own charging network, it looks like they went with the dumbest name.

title: Study of Nissan Leaf EV price in 49 countries shows shocking range in cost
short_description: Compare the Cost, a UK-based car insurance company, looked up the price of a Nissan Leaf in 49 countries. It pulled the offered price right from the official Nissan website of the latest model in February 2020. The lowest price was $28,620 in Spain. The steepest Leaf was in Singapore at $110,326.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 15, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.15.20.mp3

title: Tesla (TSLA) seen as able to ‘maintain a strong market position’, gets support from Goldman Sachs
short_description: Tesla (TSLA) is seen as being able to “maintain a strong market position” by Goldman Sachs who upgrades the company in a new coverage update.

title: Rivian releases three awesome new all-electric outdoor adventure videos
short_description: Rivian distinguishes itself from other EV makers in its mission statement: to produce emissions-free electric adventure vehicles. But with everybody on lockdown due to the pandemic, it’s a challenge to get outside. So the company took a look through its archive of past adventures and published three stunning new videos in the past week.

title: VW ID.3 electric car goes on 1,200 km road trip as they aim to keep launch timeline
short_description: VW CEO Hebert Diess gave an update on the development of the ID.3 electric car, which went on a 1,200 km road trip, as the automaker aims to keep their launch timeline.

title: Porsche R&D boss speaks about Tesla batteries, Macan EV, and why hydrogen fails
short_description: Michael Steiner, research chief for Porsche, doesn’t like to compare the Taycan with Tesla models. For Steiner, Tesla is going after volume segments, which means that it’s not a direct competitor to Porsche. The R&D chief spoke with Automotive News about Tesla’s battery design, why Porsche needs to keep improving its combustion engines, and the brand’s anti-hydrogen stance.

title: Tesla’s latest self-driving visualization comes to life in this impressive picture
short_description: Tesla has made some impressive progress in self-driving visualization with its latest software updates. Check out this new beautiful picture that represents that progress extremely well.

title: EGEB: The US’ last new coal plant proposal has been denied
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  The US’ last new coal plant proposal, in Georgia, is dead. The EPA refuses to tighten air quality standards despite the pandemic. How a conservative coal county built the biggest community solar energy project in East Kentucky.

title: The EPA refuses to tighten air quality standards despite the pandemic
short_description: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced yesterday that it will not work to lower levels of particulate matter, thus not further reducing air pollution, despite the recommendations of its own scientists to do so.

title: Tesla wins monetary settlement in lawsuit over self-driving car startup Zoox stealing secrets
short_description: Tesla has agreed to settle a lawsuit it initiated against Zoox, which is going to have to pay Tesla some money and conduct an internal audit to make sure it is not using any tesla trade secrets.

title: New VanMoof e-bike details leak: Lower price, better parts, electronic shifting
short_description: VanMoof was planning to unveil their highly anticipated next generation VanMoof S3 and X3 e-bikes later this month. But thanks to a new leak, we’re already getting an early look at the details. And boy are those details promising, as they show a pair of new VanMoofs sporting a wide array of upgrades. Better, cheaper, faster… Well, not faster. But certainly the first two are true!

title: Elon Musk: Tesla Cybertruck will have to be wrapped for different colors and patterns
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck is going to have to be wrapped in order to get different colors and patterns, according to a new comment from CEO Elon Musk.

title: Tesla to have new multi-layered paints for Model Y with ‘most-advanced paint shop’ at Giga Berlin
short_description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says that the automaker will introduce new multi-layered paints for Model Y with what he claims will be the ‘most-advanced paint shop’ at Gigafactory Berlin.

title: GM offers Chevy Bolt EV with $4,750 discount in April, no payments for 4 months
short_description: In what GM is calling a coronavirus relief package, the company is discounting the purchase of a Chevy Bolt electric car by $4,750 in cash discounts, with 0% APR financing for 72 months. Qualified buyers won’t have to make any payments for 120 days.

title: Ford Mustang Mach-E gets small power bump as it gets closer to production
short_description: The Ford Mustang Mach-E is apparently getting a small power bump as it gets closer to production, according to a document given to dealerships.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 14, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.14.20.mp3

title: EV production starts to come back online in Europe, US still in question
short_description: After weeks of being idle, auto factories producing electric cars in Europe are resuming production. Hyundai and Audi plants were the first to open, with Daimler expected to begin output next week. EV plants in China have been online for several weeks, but the plan for US production is still up in the air.

title: Tesla is still getting tons of Cybertruck orders months after electric pickup unveiling
short_description: Despite difficult times, Tesla is still getting a lot of new Cybertruck orders months after electric pickup’s unveiling, according to sources familiar with the matter.

title: Renault stops making gas cars in China, shifting sales only to electric cars
short_description: Renault announced today that it would stop making and selling gas-powered cars in China. But the French automaker will retain its interest in three different ventures to produce multiple electric vehicles in the world’s largest auto market and for export.

title: Tesla (TSLA) keeps climbing as it seeks to renegotiate its rent rates
short_description: Tesla’s (TSLA) stock price keeps climbing this morning as the automaker seeks to renegotiate its rent rates based on emails sent to its landlords.

title: EGEB: Virginia governor signs groundbreaking green energy act
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Governor Ralph Northam (D-VA) has signed the Virginia Clean Economy Act. Ten years on, the Deepwater Horizon oil spill still contaminates the Gulf of Mexico. Boston-based Eversource now provides virtual energy assessments in response to COVID-19.

title: 10 years on, spilled Deepwater Horizon oil still in fish and on ocean floor
short_description: BP’s Deepwater Horizon rig spilled around 4.9 million barrels of oil after a methane explosion on April 20, 2010, in the Gulf of Mexico — the largest marine oil spill in history. And a decade later, scientists are finding oil from that spill in the livers of fish, and on the deep ocean floor.

title: Tesla Cybertruck Gigafactory: Missouri dangles $1 billion in incentives in formal bid for the plant
short_description: Missouri has submitted an official bid to Tesla for the Cybertruck Gigafactory and they claim that it’s worth about $1 billion in incentives.

title: New 31 mph and 3,000W electric unicycle announced with true suspension
short_description: Electric unicycles might be a niche corner of the already niche market of personal electric vehicles. But that hasn’t stopped manufacturers from developing some rather impressive designs. The latest comes to us in the form of an incredibly powerful 3,000 W peak electric unicycle known as the InMotion V11.

title: Electric Ford Bronco with Tesla batteries worth $300K is up for grabs in new sweepstakes
short_description: Thank you to Omaze for sponsoring Electrek this week A Classic Electric Ford Bronco powered by Tesla batteries and apparently worth $300,000 is going to go to a lucky winner as part of a new sweepstakes.

title: Minnesota, New Mexico, and other states are poised to adopt California ZEV rules
short_description: The most effective response to the COVID pandemic has come from state leadership – not the federal government. And the same thing is happening for vehicle-emission rules. Last month, Washington state became the 12th state to adopt California’s zero-emissions mandate. Next up: Minnesota and New Mexico, with Colorado and Ohio not far behind.

title: What’s the ultimate two-EV driveway and how to charge both? See a gallery of choices
short_description: Pandemic stay-at-home orders are getting more consumers to consider buying an electric car. And the coronavirus lockdown is also inspiring more people to take daily walks in the neighborhood. On my strolls in the East Bay, across from San Francisco, I see several EVs on every block. With my neighbors sheltering in place, I am also discovering a lot of driveways with two green vehicles. I never would have expected some of the combinations – or all the different ways to set up home charging for two EVs.

title: Tesla Model Y teardown: wiring, octovalve, and whisky
short_description: A new episode of Sandy Munro’s Tesla Model Y teardown criticizes the new electric SUV’s wiring, gives a first look at Tesla’s octovalve, and it looks like Munro has been hitting the whisky.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 13, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.13.20.mp3

title: As coal use falls, electric vehicles keep getting cleaner
short_description: American coal generation declined 36% in March compared to the year before. With oil prices at new low levels, coal is now the most expensive fossil fuel on the planet. Reuters reports that nearly half of global coal plants will run at a loss this year. That’s all sad news for coal country, but it means that electric cars continue to get cleaner.

title: Tesla (TSLA) stock surges 10%: Here’s what we think is happening
short_description: Tesla’s (TSLA) stock surged by as much as 10% this morning despite a broader market pullback amid the developing coronavirus pandemic. Here’s what we think is happening.

title: Car boom begins in China, with a wave of new electric cars about to roll out
short_description: With lockdowns lifting in China, car buyers are coming back in droves. Personal vehicles have new appeal as consumers hold fears about the safety of public transit. The return of car purchasing in China could be a boon for EV makers.

title: Elon Musk: Tesla’s upcoming event will focus on batteries, not powertrain — ‘a lot to talk about’
short_description: Elon Musk elaborated on Tesla’s upcoming event. He says that despite previous comments, it will focus only on batteries and not powertrain, as they have “a lot to talk about.”

title: EGEB: Green energy became the UK’s main power source for first time in Q1 2020
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Renewables became the UK’s main power source for first time in first-quarter 2020. Oil producers make the largest production cut in history. Electric and solar-powered vans are delivering fresh produce in India during coronavirus lockdown.

title: Oil producers make the largest production cut in history — will it matter?
short_description: On Sunday, oil-producing nations agreed to the largest production cut in history. Whether that will stabilize oil prices and the industry as a whole remains to be seen.

title: Tesla Gigafactory Shanghai: new drone video shows just how massive the expansion is
short_description: Tesla is currently expanding Gigafactory Shanghai, and a new drone video now shows just how massive the new buildings are, now that the foundations are in.

title: Zero SR/F review: Here’s why it’s the leader of American electric motorcycles
short_description: Unlike the legions of interesting but questionably vaporware concept electric motorcycles floating around the internet these days, the Zero SR/F is a powerful, sporty bike that you can actually find in dealerships. It combines high power with an aggressive ride that is sure to turn a boring commute into an ear-to-ear grinning experience.

title: Tesla’s robotaxi plan is still on for this year — pending regulatory approval, says Elon Musk
short_description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says Tesla’s plan for 1 million robotaxi vehicles on the road by the end of the year is still on pending regulatory approval.

title: Tesla’s robotaxi plan is still on for this year – pending regulatory approval, says Elon Musk
short_description: Elon Musk says Tesla’s plan for 1 million robotaxi vehicles on the road by the end of the year is still on – pending regulatory approval.

title: Elon Musk reveals the reason behind Tesla’s cabin-facing camera
short_description: Elon Musk has revealed the reason behind Tesla’s cabin-facing camera that has been in the Model 3 for years without being used.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 11, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.11.20.mp3

title: Get ready for all-electric flying car races, they’re coming
short_description: The Formula E electric-vehicle racing series was conceived in 2011. Nearly a decade later, EVs are well on the way to mass commercialization. Airspeeder, the first motorsports program for electric flying cars, this week announced raising a seven-figure sum to launch its series. Founders of the flying EV series believe it could accelerate progress toward mainstream sustainable, electric air mobility.

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: Are our oceans doomed or can they heal?
short_description: New studies of our oceans see two potential pathways amid climate change — which will we take? India’s lockdown due to COVID-19 has resulted in some drastic pollution reductions. Bill Gates on the coronavirus and how learnings can help solve climate change. And more…

title: Tesla puts the majority of its sales and delivery staff on furlough
short_description: Tesla told employees today that the majority of its sales and delivery staff are going to be on furlough starting on Monday.

title: Trump’s new fuel-efficiency rule: The devil is in the details for electric cars
short_description: It’s well known that on March 31, the Trump administration gutted fuel-economy and greenhouse gas rules for model years 2021 to 2026. But what does it mean specifically for electric vehicles? Environmental law firm Beveridge & Diamond broke down the new rule, shedding light on provisions for EVs.

title: Podcast: Tesla battery day delay, Tesla Cybertruck, Full Self-Driving, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including Tesla ‘battery day’ being delay, Tesla Cybertruck new, Full Self-Driving news, and more.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Electrek-04-10-2020.mp3

title: Tesla could further its EV lead post-pandemic as legacy automakers delay electric programs
short_description: Analysts believe that Tesla could further its lead in electric vehicles post-pandemic due to other automakers delaying their electric vehicle programs, especially when it comes to electric pickup trucks.

title: You won’t believe it but this Tesla Model 3 is still ‘driveable’
short_description: A new salvaged Tesla Model 3 is hitting the market and after seeing the pictures, it’s hard to believe it is still ‘driveable’ but it is…

title: EGEB: White House denies a ‘backdoor’ NEPA comment email address. So we tested it
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Looks like the White House set up a special email address for industry to comment on NEPA. The US DoE announces $38 million for hydrokinetic turbine technology development. Saudi Arabia and Russia agree to cut oil production.

title: Energica is ‘lined up’ for electric motorcycle sales after coronavirus pandemic
short_description: Italy’s premier electric motorcycle manufacturer Energica is preparing to return to strong sales figures after being rocked hard by the current coronavirus pandemic. Now the company’s CEO Livia Cevolini is detailing how she plans to do it.

title: Tesla launches discontinued Model 3 Long Range RWD as made-in-China car
short_description: Tesla has officially launched the Model 3 Long Range RWD in China with production at Gigafactory Shanghai, a version of the electric car that it previously discontinued.

title: Tesla Model Y gets $1,000 tow hitch option, $450 roof rack accessory
short_description: Tesla just launched the Model Y with the first deliveries happening just a few weeks ago.  There were a lot of questions open about the car, most of which have been answered, but one remained: where’s the tow hitch?  We’ve got an answer to that now: it’s here,  and it’s available as a $1,000 option. And while we already knew a roof rack would eventually be available, it’s now been added to Tesla’s shop as a $450 accessory, the same price as the Model 3 roof rack.

title: The most important US energy chart of the year is out: 8 big takeaways
short_description: The 2019 US energy flowcharts released by Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) came out last night, and there are some notable changes and things we should discuss.

title: Tesla Berlin Gigafactory stalls, reportedly has to revise foundation due to soil issue
short_description: Construction at Tesla Berlin Gigafactory has reportedly stalled due to a need to revise the foundation because of the soil.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 9, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.9.20.mp3

title: Study: Pandemic lockdowns are encouraging more consumers to buy electric cars
short_description: Auto industry analysts are predicting that sales of electric vehicles will suffer badly due to the pandemic. But it’s not the first time that legacy industry sources have written off EVs. However, a new UK survey suggests that the coronavirus is making consumers more aware of the environment — and therefore more inclined to buy an electric car.

title: Tesla ‘Plaid’ Cybertruck electric pickup is Elon Musk’s new favorite Tesla vehicle
short_description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk referred to the top version of the Cybertruck as ‘Plaid’ and he said that he will be driving the new electric pickup.

title: New Ford F-150 plug-in hybrid is reported to offer about 10 miles of EV range
short_description: Two years ago, Ford outlined its plans for 40 so-called electrified vehicles in its global lineup by 2022. The company said 16 would be purely electric, and the rest would be plug-in hybrids – with a focus on its most iconic, mainstream vehicles. News is starting to trickle out about the plug-in hybrid version of the ultra-iconic F-150 pickup, with Car and Driver reporting that it will only offer around 10 miles of all-electric range.

title: Tesla sales in China hit record high during the pandemic, represent 25% of country’s EV sales
short_description: Tesla’s sales in China hit a record high in March despite the coronavirus pandemic, and it represented 25% of the country’s electric vehicle sales during the period.

title: EGEB: A world first: Offshore oil and gas platforms to be powered — by wind
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Equinor offshore oil and gas platforms will be first to be powered by a floating offshore wind farm. Air pollution really does increase coronavirus deaths. Here’s why. Poll: US voters of both parties strongly favor wind energy.

title: Elon Musk links Tesla Model Y release in Europe to Gigafactory Berlin
short_description: Elon Musk commented on something Tesla has hinted before: the Model Y coming to Europe only when it can be produced locally at Gigafactory Berlin.

title: I bought Xiaomi’s $261 electric bike from China (and brought it back to the US)
short_description: Even though electric bicycle prices in the West are dropping, with many decent e-bikes found in the sub-$1,000 range, China is still king of the inexpensive e-bikes. So I wanted to see how one of these ultra-affordable e-bikes stood up to the types of e-bikes in the US and Europe. My goal: Find one of these e-bikes and bring it to the US for testing.

title: Musk says Tesla ‘battery day’ will be mid-May… maybe
short_description: Tesla has been preparing for a “battery and powertrain investor day,” which had been planned for this month. But with the world shut down due to coronavirus, company plans have changed. Tesla CEO Elon Musk said tonight that battery day is “most likely postponed to mid May” — though it’s also “hard to predict dates right now.”

title: New electric Fiat 500 goes green bonkers with claims of eco-revolution and a pebble key fob
short_description: The new Fiat 500e was slated for its launch in early March at the canceled Geneva International Motor Show. Instead, Fiat chief Olivier François stars in an 18-minute virtual press conference for the new 500, which is exclusively electric. What unfolds in those few minutes is a jaw-dropping display of greenwashing, complete with a natural pebble key fob, melodic EV pedestrian acoustics, Leo DiCaprio name-drops, a paint job that supposedly cleans the air, and claims of an eco-revolution.

title: Air pollution really does increase coronavirus deaths. Here’s why
short_description: A Harvard University study at the T.H. Chan School of Public Health, which was updated on April 5, has confirmed that there is a direct correlation between long-term exposure to air pollution and a higher coronavirus death rate.

title: Tesla Cybertruck might have a ladder rack based on newly found render, making workers happy
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck might be able to have a ladder rack, which was unclear because of the electric truck’s design, based on a newly found render from Tesla’s presentation.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 8, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.8.20.mp3

title: Electrify America puts another Band-Aid on problematic by-the-minute EV charging
short_description: Electrify America and Hyundai-Kia have a two-fold problem with their fees for fast-charging. First, where it is allowable, the fees are based on time and charged  by the minute. The second part of the problem is that those fees are tiered, based on the maximum possible kW charging rate ­– not the rate that your car actually charges. Today, Electrify America announced a temporary fix for the Kia Niro EV by ditching the tiers and charging a flat rate of $0.35 per minute.

title: Tesla Model Y teardown: shows some great improvements over Model 3 despite sharing 75% of parts
short_description: The latest Tesla Model Y teardown videos show how Tesla managed to make some great improvements over Model 3 despite sharing 75% of parts with the electric sedan.

title: Tesla releases impressive look inside Gigafactory Shanghai, with its hundreds of robots
short_description: Tesla has released a video with an impressive look inside Gigafactory Shanghai, which is currently Tesla’s only vehicle factory in operation.

title: Tesla dominates Kelley Blue Book Luxury Brand 2020 Awards
short_description: Tesla cleaned house in the 2020 Kelley Blue Book Luxury Brand Image awards announced today. In fact, if it weren’t for an aberration in the “Most Trusted” category, Tesla would have gotten the full 6 category sweep.

title: EGEB: Spain breaks solar record during March coronavirus lockdown
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Spain broke its solar record in March when it was on coronavirus lockdown. Federal court rules EPA’s greenhouse-gas-prevention rule suspension illegal. Ørsted completes its largest onshore wind farm to date, in Texas.

title: Federal court declares EPA’s harmful rollback of greenhouse-gas rule illegal
short_description: On February 29, Electrek reported that the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) had finalized a rule that eliminated leak prevention and repair requirements for hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs), the heat-trapping pollutants used in commercial and industrial refrigeration. Yesterday, a federal court struck down the EPA’s rollback of the greenhouse-gas-leak prevention rule. The court said that the Trump administration did not follow proper procedure.

title: New ‘Lightest’ mid-drive electric bike conversion kit offers up to 1,200W
short_description: The Italian electric bicycle conversion kit company Bikee Bike has a new lightweight kit known as the Lightest. As the name implies, Bikee says this is the lightest weight e-bike kit on the market, with the mid-drive unit weighing just 1.65 kg (3.5 lb).

title: First look at Tesla’s launch mode with ‘Cheetah stance’: proves to be slightly quicker
short_description: Tesla started pushing a new software update that includes an updated Launch mode with what Tesla calls a ‘Cheetah stance’ and the first real-world tests are coming in.

title: Tesla announces pay cuts, furloughs, and aims to get back to production by May 4
short_description: In an email to employees leaked to Electrek today, Tesla is announcing pay cuts and furloughs while it also says that it plans to resume production by May 4.

title: Tesla is using blockchain technology to help with its Gigafactory Shanghai logistic
short_description: Tesla has been confirmed to be a partner in a new project to use blockchain technology to help with logistics in importing products for Gigafactory Shanghai.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 7, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.7.20.mp3

title: Volvo joins automakers siding with California on emissions, opposing Trump administration
short_description: Donald Trump last week gutted fuel economy standards, a direct attack on electric vehicles. The move further separates federal emissions standards from California’s strong zero-emission rules. Thank goodness, BMW, Ford, Honda, and Volkswagen sided with California by striking individual deals with the state for higher efficiency. Now Volvo joins those four automakers by directly negotiating with California about emissions.

title: VW, Porsche, and Mazda cling to internal combustion, citing benefits of biofuels
short_description: Fears about the end of internal-combustion vehicles are a real thing for some automakers. In the past week or two, Volkswagen, Porsche, and Mazda all championed the long-term future of internal-combustion vehicles by pointing to the potential of synthetic and biofuels, such as ethanol and microalgae.

title: Tesla Virtual Power Plant with Powerwalls proves successful in early phase, report says
short_description: Tesla is participating in a massive ‘Virtual Power Plant’ using its Powerwall in South Australia and the first phase of the system is already proving successful according to a new report.

title: Tesla prepares to increase the price of ‘Full Self-Driving’ again with new features
short_description: Tesla is preparing to increase the price of its “Full Self-Driving” package again as new features are coming — keeping the promise of increasing the value.

title: Senators ask EPA why it’s allowing pollution as coronavirus attacks lungs
short_description: As Electrek reported on March 27, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced a suspension of the enforcement of environmental rules, saying it “will generally not seek stipulated or other penalties for noncompliance with such obligations” during the coronavirus outbreak. There is no end date for this policy. The coronavirus attacks lungs, often causing pneumonia, and severely impedes the ability of those with more severe cases to breathe. Air pollution also harms lungs. So now, the senators from Massachusetts want explanations for the EPA’s decision.

title: Rivian will likely push first deliveries of its electric vehicles into 2021
short_description: Rivian was expected to make the first customer deliveries of its electric truck later this year. The company slowed down work at its factory in Normal, Illinois, in mid-March, and then shut down operations there on March 20. The Pantagraph, a local newspaper in the Bloomington-Normal area, now says that Rivian’s first deliveries will slip into 2021.

title: EGEB: In 2019, 72% of the world’s new energy projects were green
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Green energy made up nearly three-quarters of the world’s new energy projects in 2019. Warren and Markey ask why the EPA aren’t enforcing pollution rules during the pandemic. Oslo is undertaking what is apparently the world’s first net-zero construction project.

title: Polestar Precept: close look at the sleek new electric sedan
short_description: Polestar has released a close look at the Precept, a new electric sedan that shows the Swedish automaker’s design direction.

title: CAKE launches new street-legal electric motorcycle based on more affordable design
short_description: Stockholm-based CAKE may have begun with electric dirt bikes, but the company is quickly establishing itself on the road as well. CAKE announced today the launch of its fourth street-legal electric motorcycle, the CAKE Kalk INK SL.

title: First look at Tesla’s new Dashcam/Sentry mode viewer
short_description: Tesla is releasing a new Dashcam/Sentry mode viewer which was a highly requested feature, and hacker green is bringing us a first look at it.

title: Watch this wild video of a retractable solar EV-charging car cover
short_description: Imagine parking your EV, pushing a button, and a solar EV-charging cover automatically unfurls to protect your car and add a few miles of range. That’s exactly what a French company that produces thin-film photovoltaics and a French EV startup created. While still in the prototype phase, and presented in a goofy video, the idea is maybe not as far-fetched as it first seems.

title: Tesla is making improvements to Fremont factory — increasing Model Y production capacity
short_description: Tesla is making several improvements to Fremont factory during the shutdown in order to increase production capacity for Model Y and other vehicles.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 6, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.6.20.mp3

title: Green light for Mercedes-Benz EQS AMG sedan, a 600hp electric luxury beast
short_description: When Mercedes-Benz unveiled the Mercedes EQS electric sedan last year, the company said that a pair of electric motors would produce 350 kilowatts (470hp) of power. The UK’s Autocar now reports that an AMG high-power version of the EQS will be produced, amping things up to higher than 600 horsepower. It appears that Mercedes-Benz wants EVs that stack up against Tesla’s Plaid versions, even if not quite as powerful.

title: Tesla updates its solar subscription program – making cost of removing system vague
short_description: Tesla has updated its solar subscription program – making the cost of removing a solar array from someone’s roof vague.

title: Hyundai’s latest EV concept is a visual mash-up of Model 3, Porsche 911, and Mercedes EQS
short_description: Hyundai did a digital reveal of its Prophecy EV concept last month. Now the company says the model is more than a concept. According to Hyundai, the Prophecy is a showcase of vehicle features that will be offered in the not-too-distant future.

title: Tesla (TSLA) stock rallies as analysts see EV automaker fare better than rest of industry in this crisis
short_description: Tesla’s stock (TSLA) is rallying today as Wall Street analysts see the EV automaker potentially faring better than the rest of the industry in this crisis.

title: EGEB: Kansas utilities overcharging green energy users is ruled illegal
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  The Kansas Supreme Court rules that state utilities cannot price gouge solar and wind users. Savannah becomes the fifth Georgia city to commit to 100% clean energy by 2050. Reminder: Science and green energy can be fun. Check out Mystery Science live on Tuesday.

title: Super73 Z1 e-bike review: How good can Super73’s cheapest electric bike be?
short_description: Super73 is all about the laid-back, Southern California style. These electric bikes place an emphasis on the mini-bike styling and give the feel of zooming around town on an electric moped or motorbike. But with many of the full-featured Super73 e-bikes starting at $2k or more, I wanted to see if you could get the same kind of experience on the $1,150 Super73-Z1, which is the company’s entry level model.

title: Tesla gets in trouble for using HAL 9000 for Sentry Mode, switching to Portal turret
short_description: Tesla apparently got in trouble for using imagery representing HAL 9000 from the movie ‘2001: A Space Odyssey’ for Sentry Mode so it is switching to something that now seems inspired by a turret from the video game Portal.

title: Savannah, Georgia, commits to 100% green energy by 2050 despite coronavirus
short_description: Savannah becomes the fifth Georgia city to commit to reaching 100% renewable energy by 2050. It joins Athens, Atlanta, Augusta, and Clarkston in their commitment to net zero.

title: Tesla releases first video of its ventilator made out of car parts
short_description: Tesla has released a new video about the progress it is making in its effort to produce ventilators out of car parts.

title: Tesla Model Y third-row seat might make more sense rear-facing — what do you think?
short_description: In the latest set of Tesla Model Y teardowns, we see that there is a significant amount of potential human room in the rear area. This is particularly true due to the large cutout underneath the trunk floor, which could offer plenty of legroom to seat adults in the third row… if it were backwards. But will Tesla make its Model Y third row rear-facing like the Model S, or the more traditional forward-facing variety like the Model X? Let’s discuss…

title: Tesla is working on something called ‘Cheetah stance’ for the perfect launch
short_description: Tesla is working on a new version of “Launch Mode” that will include something called “Cheetah stance” to involve the adaptive suspension in a launch from a standstill.

title: Elon Musk: Tesla is going to ‘simplify’ Plaid tri-motor upgrade, ‘was getting too complex’
short_description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk says that Tesla is going to ‘simplify’ its upcoming Plaid tri-motor upgrade as it “was getting too complex.”

title: Quick Charge Podcast: April 4, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn, and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Quick-Charge-4.4.20.mp3

title: Volkswagen extends E-Golf production until September, according to VW internal document
short_description: Volkswagen needs to increase its output of electric cars to meet CO2 regulations in the EU. But reportedly, the company continues to work through software problems with its upcoming new ID.3 EV model expected this summer. Now an internal VW document reveals that production of the E-Golf, VW’s current but discontinued best-selling EV, will be extended to around September. Customer deliveries in Europe will be pushed until the end of November.

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: How climate change and COVID-19 are connected — WHO
short_description: A WHO climate change adviser explains how climate change and the coronavirus are linked. The crucial COP26 in Glasgow has now been postponed to mid-2021 due to the coronavirus. Sir David Attenborough: “The natural world produces the comfort that can come from nothing else.” And more…

title: The full story (and winner) of the Harley LiveWire vs. Tesla Model 3 electric drag race
short_description: Earlier this month we got a sneak peak at the first-ever drag race between a Harley-Davidson LiveWire electric motorcycle and Tesla Model 3 Performance electric car. The original video, shot from the stands, lacked any background info, and the winner of the photo finish wasn’t clear. Now we’ve got the full story behind the race (and we finally know the winner too!).

title: Tesla is aiming to release Autopilot for intersections in just weeks in the US, will take months for other markets
short_description: Tesla is aiming to release the ability for Autopilot to navigate intersections in just weeks in the US, but it will take months for other markets.

title: Bolt sales up 36% in Q1 compared to last year, as GM EV tax credit disappears
short_description: Chevrolet increased Q1 2020 sales of the Bolt EV by 36.1% compared to a year ago. The rise in purchases of the all-electric Bolt defied the gravity of a dismal quarter for overall Chevrolet sales. With help from attractive discounts and incentives, Chevy sold 5,873 Bolts — an amount that could make it the second most popular EV in the US.

title: Podcast: Tesla Q1 2020 numbers, Tesla Autopilot in traffic lights, Solar roof, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including Tesla’s Q1 2020 delivery and production numbers, Tesla Autopilot navigating traffic lights, new Solar roof information, and more.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/04/Electrek-04-03-2020.mp3

title: Korea plans thousands of fast EV charging at gas stations, now 76 and counting
short_description: There will come a day when ultra-fast, electric-vehicle charging stations are as ubiquitous as gas stations. South Korea is making progress toward that goal with thousands on the roadmap and at least 76 gas stations already equipped for rapid EV pit stops.

title: BMW starts construction of China plant, where all-electric 3-Series is planned
short_description: BMW’s majority-owned Chinese company, BMW-Brilliance, began construction this week of a 3.2-square-kilometer plant. The expanded facility will help BMW produce 150,000 EVs a year in China. The list of models includes all-electric versions of the 3-Series and 5-Series sedans, as well as the X1 crossover and another SUV EV.

title: Tesla Model Y teardown: wiring and body casting impress expert
short_description: Tesla Model Y’s wiring architecture and body casting, especially at the rear, is not disappointing in the first teardown of the new electric SUV.

title: VW releases video of insane heads-up display in ID.3 electric car
short_description: VW has released a series of videos about some of the more interesting features of the ID.3 electric car, including an insane heads-up display.

title: EGEB: Trump holds Big Oil crisis meeting at the White House
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Donald Trump will meet with Big Oil executives today as the fossil-fuel industry is in tailspin. Shell’s offshore wind-to-hydrogen program in the Netherlands will survive the coronavirus. Germany is a little too productive with green energy right now, so has to work on its grid.

title: Tesla releases Dashcam Viewer software update, allows TeslaCam, Sentry Mode viewing in car
short_description: Tesla has started pushing a new software update that enables drivers to review videos from TeslaCam and Sentry Mode directly in the car.

title: Delfast rolls out two new powerful e-bikes, touts 245 mile range
short_description: If you’ve been looking for a high power, long range electric bicycle with an emphasis on the “e” and only a passing reference to the “bicycle”, then this could be right up your alley. The Ukrainian e-bike company Delfast has just announced all-new versions of their high power and long range electric bikes known as the Delfast Prime 2.0 and Partner 2.0.

title: Ford explores ‘Cash For Clunkers’ stimulus plan, a potential boost for US-made EVs
short_description: After March auto sales tanked due to the pandemic, Ford today became the first automaker to propose a government stimulus program for the auto industry. One approach would be a “Cash For Clunkers” program based on the 2009 stimulus measure.
