title: Oregon Fire Department begins Arcimoto pilot program
short_description: The Eugene, Oregon Fire Department started an Arcimoto EV rapid responder pilot program. The Arcimoto Rapid Responder is modular and homemade.

title: Tesla gets ready to deliver Model Y, adds new configuration
short_description: Tesla is about to start delivering the Model Y, its new electric SUV, and it is confirming delivery for one more configuration: the white interior.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: March 11, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/03/Quick-Charge-3.11.20.mp3

title: GM CEO: EV adoption needs to shift from ‘regulatory-driven to customer-driven’
short_description: Last week, General Motors unveiled an entire portfolio of about a dozen electric vehicles that it plans to sell in the next four years. At the event, we had the chance to speak with Mary Barra, GM’s chief executive. We asked Barra about EV profitability, regulations, and the big-ness of most of its upcoming electric vehicles.

title: BMW ends production of the i8 electric sports car next month
short_description: BMW i8, the best-selling plug-in hybrid sports car, is going to see the end of its production run next month after about 20,000 units produced.

title: Washington State passes bill to become a ZEV state, pushes for ban of gas cars
short_description: Washington State’s Senate narrowly passed SB 5811 this week, paving the way for the Evergreen State to become the 12th to adopt California’s zero-emissions mandate. SB 5811 passed the House in January, and Gov. Jay Inslee is expected to sign the bill. When that happens, the entire US west coast will require that at least 5% of auto sales are EVs, increasing to 8% by 2025.

title: Former Google CEO funds updated US electricity-price database
short_description: The US is about to get a comprehensive database of electricity prices that will be available to the public. The US Department of Energy’s National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) and WattBuy, an energy intelligence service for consumers, is working together to bring the current national database up to speed. The initiative is funded through a grant from Schmidt Futures, a philanthropic initiative co-founded by former Google CEO Eric Schmidt and his wife, Wendy.

title: EGEB: Honolulu files lawsuit against 10 oil and gas companies
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Honolulu files a lawsuit against oil and gas companies for monetary damages due to climate change. The US gets a public database that will comprehensively collect and maintain all electricity rates. Former US Secretary of State John Kerry will speak at June’s Movin’On Summit in Montreal.

title: CSC FT750 review: I tested electric bicycles from a motorcycle company
short_description: There’s nothing in the company’s name, CSC Motorcycles, that would hint at the awesome electric bicycles they recently designed and debuted. But CSC has spent the last couple years expanding from their traditional gas-powered motorcycle offerings into a range of light electric motorcycles (which I’ve also tested!), and now a pair of electric bicycles known as the CSC FT750 series. And you didn’t think I was going to miss a chance to try out a pair of the newest electric bicycles in the US, did you?

title: Tesla Gigafactory Shanghai: Drone video shows massive new building is coming up
short_description: Despite the coronavirus situation in China, Tesla is moving ahead with the expansion of its Gigafactory Shanghai, and a new drone video shows a massive new building coming up as part of phase 2 of the construction.

title: Tesla Cybertruck Gigafactory: Nashville in the running, Elon is looking for ‘incentives, workforce, and more’
short_description: Tesla is looking for a new gigafactory in the “central US” to produce the Cybertruck electric pickup truck and Model Y. CEO Elon Musk says that he is looking for “incentives, a workforce, and more” as Nashville is said to be in the running.

title: Tesla plans to build the Cybertruck in ‘central USA’ — possibly Texas?
short_description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced today that Tesla has started scouting locations for Cybertruck production and plans to build the truck in “central USA.” Previously, Musk suggested that Tesla was looking into Texas for a factory.  At the time he did not specify that it would be for Cybertruck production, but these two ideas would line up.

title: Lexus dealer spams Tesla owners: ‘You’ve had your fun, now it’s time for zero compromise’
short_description: A Lexus dealer in Texas is spamming Tesla owners to encourage them to trade in their Tesla vehicle, telling them: “You’ve had your fun, now it’s time for zero compromise.”

title: Quick Charge Podcast: March 10, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/03/Quick-Charge-3.10.20.mp3

title: Tesla gets banned from KC Auto Show, owners volunteer to take over
short_description: Tesla vehicles were banned from being displayed at the Kansas City Auto Show because the car dealer association doesn’t accept the automaker’s direct sales model, but Tesla owners took the matter into their own hands.

title: Coronavirus threatens momentum for electric vehicles
short_description: More than 3,000 people have died from the coronavirus so far. And we still don’t know how far the virus will reach. At the same time, the virus is having an unanticipated impact on emerging technologies with global supply chains. That includes electric cars.

title: Who killed the electric BMW iX3? US dealers wanting longer range
short_description: News emerged only yesterday that BMW had canceled plans to launch the BMW iX3 in the United States. But Automotive News reported that BMW had already decided to kill US sales of the iX3 in January at dealers meeting in Boca Raton, if not earlier. BMW executives and dealers deemed the all-electric iX3 as a dud before it reached our shores. Why? Its 74-kilowatt-hour battery pack is considered by Americans to be too small.

title: Watch Tesla Model 3 modded by Unplugged Performance beat McLaren F1’s time at famous racetrack
short_description: Unplugged Performance released a video of its modified Tesla Model 3 Performance beating the McLaren F1’s time at the famous Tsukuba Circuit.

title: EGEB: Virginia passes green energy legislation hailed as ‘transformational’
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  The state of Virginia passes landmark green energy legislation. Global carbon dioxide emissions fell by 2% in 2019. Companies in the UK will spend £12 billion over the next two years on switching to EVs.

title: Tesla to add production capacity for 250,000 cars at Gigafactory Shanghai
short_description: Newly revealed documents show that Tesla is preparing to add production capacity for 250,000 cars per year at Gigafactory Shanghai.

title: Tesla sales surprise in China amid crisis, owns about a third of the EV market
short_description: Tesla’s sales in China have been keeping up surprisingly well in February as the coronavirus crisis escalated in the country. The American automaker owned about a third of the EV market in China last month.

title: Swytch electric bike conversion kit transitions to full ‘crowd-shopping’ sales
short_description: The London-based startup Swytch Technology, known for its unique electric bicycle conversion kit, is a classic example of a crowdfunding success story. And now that the company has successfully entered production of its novel e-bike conversion kits, they are sticking with the crowd theme with the rollout of a new “crowd-shopping” strategy. Swytch today announced that it will be pairing the new sales method with a steep 50% discount on its popular electric bicycle conversion kits.

title: Tesla produces its 1 millionth electric car
short_description: Tesla announced that it produced its 1 millionth electric car — becoming the first automaker to achieve the milestone.

title: Best electric scooter under 30 lbs? Battle of the lightweight scooters!
short_description: Don’t get me wrong, I love big and powerful electric scooters. But I don’t really want to carry a 95 lb (43 kg) electric scooter onto the subway or the bus. That’s where lightweight electric scooters come in. Today we’re going to have a good old-fashioned face-off between some of the most popular lightweight electric scooters under 30 lb (13.6 kg) to see which one could be right for your commute.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: March 9, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/03/Quick-Charge-3.9.20.mp3

title: Tesla Cybertruck and Model Y gain tons of mindshare, survey shows
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck is starting to get on truck buyers’ radar, even edging out Dodge’s best-selling truck, and Model Y attracts a lot of interest from car buyers, according to a new survey.

title: Electric-car production and sales in Europe to surpass US, with China in sight
short_description: The center of gravity in the EV world is shifting to Europe. A report released last week from McKinsey, the consulting firm, pegs Germany to become the world market leader for electric cars by 2021, with more than 1.7 million electric vehicles produced.

title: Tesla Autopilot automatically avoids head-on collision with car in wrong lane
short_description: A Tesla driver claims that Autopilot automatically moved to avoid a head-on collision with a car in the wrong lane on the highway.

title: Volvo launches Belgium battery assembly line for all-electric XC40 crossover
short_description: Volvo last week formally inaugurated a brand-new EV battery assembly line at its Belgian manufacturing plant in Ghent. That’s where it will start building the XC40 Recharge, its first pure electric car, later this year.

title: BMW cancels plan to launch iX3 electric SUV in the US
short_description: BMW has canceled its plan to launch the BMW iX3, its first electric vehicle in years, in the US – following several other automakers focusing their EV supply in other markets.

title: EGEB: Los Angeles and Navajo Nation move from coal to green energy together
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  The Navajo Nation and the City of Los Angeles pair up to embrace green energy together. Saudi Arabia cuts its crude price in a signal to Russia after OPEC talks fail. 50 small steps you can take to help make your life greener.

title: Saudi-Russia oil war collapses prices — and the US is in the middle
short_description: Russia refused to cut oil output quotas by up to 1.5 million barrels per day at a failed meeting on Friday between OPEC and non-OPEC nations. So in retaliation, Saudi Arabia will produce 2 million barrels per day at $6 to $7 a barrel into an already oversupplied global market. As a result, oil prices have dropped by a third today.

title: Tesla deploys new Megapack in Canada, could save small utility $200,000 per year
short_description: Tesla has deployed a Megapack, its newest and biggest energy storage system, in Canada and it could save the small electric utility up to $200,000 per year.

title: BULLS launches three new electric bicycles with Fazua’s removable motors
short_description: While some electric bicycles are getting stronger, heavier, and closer to electric motorcycles, others are focusing on reducing weight and retaining as much of the non-electric bike feel as possible. BULLS’ three new electric bicycles are likely to appeal to more traditional cyclists who prefer lightweight e-bikes with assist that complements a more traditional-styled pedal ride.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: March 7, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/03/Quick-Charge-3.7.2020.mp3

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: This couple grew a forest in India, and tigers came
short_description: How a couple created a tiger reserve in India by buying land and letting forest grow back. Hey, New Yorkers: ’80s rocker Billy Idol wants you to stop “idling” your fossil-fuel cars. American station in Antarctica records the warmest February in 53 years. And more…

title: Why Exxon’s CEO ‘has his head buried in the tar sands’
short_description: ExxonMobil held its investor day at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) yesterday, and its CEO, Darren Woods, dismissed carbon targets as a “beauty match” with other companies.

title: Xpeng P7 has the highest official Chinese EV range
short_description: Xpeng is boasting that its P7 EV boasts the highest range of EVs made or assembled in China. This was verified by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT) of China.

title: Podcast: GM EV day, Tesla Track package, MCU2 upgrade, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including GM’s EV day, Tesla launching its new Track package and Track Mode, the new MCU2 upgrade, and more.

title: I bought the cheapest Tesla Model X ever: $30,000 electric SUV
short_description: I bought what is most likely the cheapest Tesla Model X ever – excluding salvaged vehicles since this car is still in good working condition. I got Tesla’s flagship electric SUV for just $30,000. Here’s how it is possible to get a working 2016 Tesla Model X 90D, which was retailing for about $100,000, for just $30,000.

title: Honda confirms second EV for Europe while US buyers get more hybrids
short_description: Honda will begin to sell its all-electric Honda e minicar in Europe this summer. Tom Gardner, Honda’s Europe chief, this week confirmed that a second EV from the Japanese automaker will also launch in Europe between 2021 and 2022. Details were not provided.

title: Tesla Cybertruck: here is where most pre-orders are coming from
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck might be a polarizing vehicle, but there are plenty of people getting in line to buy it. Here is where most pre-orders are coming from by state.

title: Peugeot chief says only ‘green addicts’ buy EVs due to lack of charging stations
short_description: Carlos Tavares is the chief executive of PSA, the second-largest carmaker in Europe. In about a year, PSA will very likely merge with Fiat Chrysler (FCA), putting Tavares in charge of what will be the fourth-largest automaker in the world. The CEO this week said that without subsidies, EV demand collapses. “We are selling our electric vehicles to green addicts,” said Tavares.

title: EGEB: US cities are banning natural gas — and states are trying to stop them
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Local and state governments are at odds over natural gas bans. Connecticut lawmaker wants insurers to pull away from fossil fuels. Northwestern Arizona will get hundreds of jobs as the result of a new wind farm.

title: Tesla gets green light to start producing new Model 3 Long Range in China
short_description: Tesla has received the green light to start producing a new version of the Model 3 Long Range RWD in China.

title: ONYX RCR First ride: Flying fast on this 60 mph electric moped
short_description: An electric moped in the truest sense of the word “moped,” the ONYX RCR is a beast of an electric motorbike. I’ve admired this bike for nearly two years now. I’ve covered the development and rollout of the ONYX RCR since the very beginning, starting with the company’s crowdfunding in the summer of 2018. Yet a chance to actually ride one had eluded me until now. And so it was with a supreme sense of delayed gratification that I finally swung my leg over an ONYX RCR last week.

title: First Tesla Model Y VINs hint at production volume
short_description: Tesla has started releasing the first Vehicle Identification Numbers (VIN) for Model Y, hinting at the production volume of the electric SUV.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: March 5, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/03/Quick-Charge-3.5.20.mp3

title: Tesla releases Track Mode V2 – like a racing video game in your car
short_description: Tesla released the new version of Track Mode and it’s like having a racing video game version of your actual track performance in your electric car.

title: GM says its new low-cobalt EV battery cell has 60% more capacity
short_description: Any legitimate EV development program starts with the batteries that make electric vehicles go. So when General Motors (GM) yesterday laid out its multi-brand, multi-segment EV strategy — for getting to 1 million EV sales per year asap — it presented the company’s flexible Ultium battery system as the key.

title: Ford F150 Electric 2022 rendered based on inside info
short_description: The Ford F150 Electric 2022 is getting new renders based on some inside info – giving us our best look yet at the upcoming electric pickup truck.

title: Bird unveils new Scoot Moped, a seated electric scooter with big potential
short_description: Electric mobility company Bird is rolling out its electric Scoot Moped in Austin, Texas today. Despite early sightings of the seated personal electric vehicles in Los Angeles last year, Bird is calling this the first official launch of the Scoot Moped.

title: GM’s new electric visual design strategy: make EVs big and badass
short_description: GM’s display of 10 new EVs yesterday gave journalists practically no time to study specific design features. No photos were allowed. But the overall impression of the vehicle lineup was unmistakable. Those electric vehicles – most notably the ones badged as GMC Hummer and Cadillac – were big and badass.

title: Porsche smartly copies Tesla’s ‘Destination Charging’ model, already over 1,000 stations
short_description: We have been saying for a while that when it comes to charging infrastructure, automakers should just copy Tesla’s model. Porsche smartly did with its new Tesla’s “Porsche Destination Charging,” which appears to be inspired by Tesla’s charging network of the same name.

title: EGEB: Florida builds largest community solar program in the US
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  The SolarTogether program will develop 1,490MW of solar over the next two years. A former chemical executive put in the EPA by Trump is now tapped to head the CPSC. Red diesel is expected to be scrapped in the UK.

title: Tesla releases new software update with improved regen braking, new Track Mode, and more
short_description: Tesla is starting to release a new over-the-air software update with a lot of small new features and improvements, including new Autopilot visualization in several markets.

title: Fox to guard a new henhouse? Chemical exec who joined EPA tapped as CPSC head
short_description: Donald Trump has nominated Nancy B. Beck to head up the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC), an independent federal agency responsible for — as the title says — consumer product safety. For more than five years, Beck was a senior director at the American Chemistry Council (ACC), the chemical industry’s main lobbying group. She then joined the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) in May 2017 as deputy assistant administrator of the Office of Chemical Safety and Pollution Prevention and was promoted to principal deputy assistant administrator in December 2018.

title: Lucid plans nine showrooms by the end of the year for its electric car
short_description: Lucid just announced its Lucid Air retail strategy, nine specific retail network locations, and plans for future growth.

title: American-built electric bicycles: How one Southern California company does it
short_description: At a time when nearly every US-based electric bicycle company imports their e-bikes from Asian factories, one California-based company proudly builds its e-bikes locally. Newport Beach-based Electric Bike Company invited me out to its factory south of Los Angeles to see for myself what goes into the process of building high quality, American-made electric beach cruisers.

title: How to buy an electric car for less than $10,000
short_description: One of the questions I get most often is, When am I going to be able to afford an electric car? That’s a complex question, but I think it’s important for people to know that they can buy an electric car today for less than $10,000.

title: Tesla updates mobile app for Model Y
short_description: Tesla has pushed a new update to its mobile app in preparation for the launch of the Model Y, the fourth vehicle in Tesla’s lineup.

title: Boosted lays off most of its staff, blames financial troubles on Trump tariffs
short_description: In a surprise move, electric skateboard and e-scooter company Boosted confirmed its severe financial troubles and laid off most of its staff.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: March 4, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/03/Quick-Charge-3.4.20.mp3

title: I saw all of GM’s upcoming electric vehicles: EV Hummers, huge Cadillacs, new Bolts E/UVs — AMA at 7 p.m. ET
short_description: Hi folks, I’m currently flying back from Detroit after the electric car event. We did a bunch of posts about the EV news coming out of the event, but there are tons of nuances to be covered. I had a firsthand look at a dozen unreleased electric vehicles from GM, but we couldn’t take any pictures or videos. GM said they would provide images and video afterward, but nothing they provided really shows off these vehicles and technology in a way that we saw in person. I’m doing an AMA on YouTube later tonight at 7 p.m. ET (4 p.m. PT). Put your questions below or on YouTube, and I will do my best to answer them.

title: Daimler delivers more electric Freightliner eCascadia semi-trucks
short_description: Full-size electric semi-trucks are real now and on the road. Daimler announced that it delivered more electric Freightliner semi-trucks as part of its customer test fleet.

title: Tesla to release more self-driving features in March — city street autopilot?
short_description: Tesla plans to release more features to expand its full self-driving capabilities later this month, according to CEO Elon Musk.

title: Cadillac Lyriq: GM’s first next-gen electric SUV built on new modular EV platform
short_description: GM has released more details today about what is now called the ‘Cadillac Lyriq’, GM’s first next-gen electric SUV built on its new modular EV platform.

title: Chevy Bolt EUV shown with Super Cruise, longer wheelbase, improved design
short_description: GM didn’t just show off the new 2021 Chevy Bolt EV today, they unleashed the long-rumored more crossover version of the Bolt called the EUV…and it came with some surprises along the way.

title: GM EV news hub: EV platform, Bolt EV, EUV, Cadillac electric, and more
short_description: GM is releasing a lot of electric vehicle news today and we have a lot to cover. You can keep track of all the announcements in this news hub.

title: 2021 Chevy Bolt revealed — significant redesign and your requests answered
short_description: Fresh off our GM electrification media and analyst tour, where we weren’t allowed to take pictures or video, I had some time to sit in the redesigned 2021 Chevy Bolt and Bolt EUV. Below, I’ll discuss changes to the Bolt and will post a second article to cover the new, longer Chevy Bolt EUV.

title: GM reveals 10 new production EVs all at once, with range up to 400 miles
short_description: General Motors held an EV-unveiling event today that was unprecedented in the volume and range of zero-emission vehicles intended for production. Instead of showing a single new model, or one aspect of electric-propulsion technology, the company fanned out its entire upcoming portfolio using all four of GM’s existing brands: Chevrolet, Cadillac, GMC, and Buick. Mark Reuss, GM’s president, said, “Everything you see here is real.”

title: TORP’s new lightweight 15kW e-bike is a powerful electric motorbike
short_description: Croatia-based TORP has been hard at work developing a powerful electric motorbike that could combine speed and agility in a single vehicle. Now the company is ready to show off their creation, the TORP Bike.

title: EGEB: Bill Gates-led fund invests in sustainable palm-oil alternative startup
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Breakthrough Energy Ventures invests in a startup that makes sustainable palm-oil alternatives. Russia’s largest wind farm begins to supply electricity and power. Looks like solar will get a boost in West Virginia, but state legislators still debated it.

title: Your Tesla could soon drop you off and go find its own parking spot
short_description: Tesla could soon release its “Reverse Summon” feature, which could enable owners to have their electric car drop them off and go find their own parking spots.

title: CAKE unveils lower-priced 50 mph electric motorcycle, the Kalk INK
short_description: Swedish electric motorcycle manufacturer CAKE has just announced a new model known as the CAKE Kalk INK. The bike is built on the same platform as CAKE’s legendary Kalk OR electric dirt bike, yet features updates that have helped CAKE substantially reduce the price.

title: Cadillac to unveil first electric SUV in April
short_description: Cadillac confirmed today that it is going to unveil its first electric vehicle, an SUV, on April 2 in Los Angeles.

title: Harley-Davidson leans further into electric vehicles, new e-bike logos filed
short_description: Harley-Davidson (H-D) hasn’t been shy about expanding its focus into electric two-wheelers, including Harley-Davidson electric bicycles and e-motorcycles. However, so far, we’ve only seen one vehicle make it to production: the Harley-Davidson LiveWire electric motorcycle. The latest clues indicating that the LiveWire will be getting a few little electric brothers come in the form of these recent filings for upcoming H-D electric vehicles.

title: Ford is going to make Transit electric van in the US in 2022
short_description: Ford announced today that it is bringing an electric version of its Transit cargo van to the US in 2022 after announcing an European launch for 2021.

title: Tesla delivers Model 3 without self-driving computer, blames supply chain issue
short_description: Tesla has delivered several Model 3 vehicles without its latest self-driving computer in China and the automaker is blaming a supply chain issue.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: March 3, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/03/Quick-Charge-3.3.20.2.mp3

title: A stunning Tesla-Powered 1968 Porsche 911 is up for grabs
short_description: A 1968 Porsche 911 converted to electric power with a Tesla drivetrain is up for grabs in a new sweepstakes for the benefit of the Petersen Automotive Museum.

title: Tesla releases software update boosting displayed range of Model S/X vehicles
short_description: Tesla has started pushing a new software update boosting the displayed range of the most recent Model S and Model X vehicles after announcing the new “Long Range Plus” version.

title: Renault brings its ultra-cheap K-ZE electric crossover to Europe under Dacia brand
short_description: Renault is going to bring its ultra-cheap China-made K-ZE electric crossover to Europe under its Dacia brand.

title: EGEB: The UK lifts four-year onshore wind-farm ban
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Prime Minister Boris Johnson lifts David Cameron’s UK moratorium on onshore wind farms. Researchers in Scotland discover a new fuel-cell compound that could revolutionize green energy. Germany breaks a green energy usage record in February.

title: GM will add 3,500 free EV charging stations for its employees
short_description: General Motors announced today that it will add 3,500 EV chargers to its facilities in the US and Canada. This represents a tripling of workplace charging at GM plants and offices. Daniel Flores, manager of communications at GM, said, “Charging is free for GM employees and will continue to be free.”

title: BMW unveils i4 electric car: a stunning Gran Coupe with a massive screen
short_description: BMW has unveiled the i4, its latest electric car, at a presentation that was planned for the Geneva Motor Show. The new prototype of this stunning Gran Coupe is still only a concept, but BMW has confirmed plans to bring a production version to market next year.

title: VW releases more details on ID.4: 300-mile range, first global electric car and more
short_description: VW has released more details on its next electric car, ID.4, which is going to be its first global next-gen electric vehicle with 300 miles of range.

title: Byton starts EU €500 pre-orders later this year, Switzerland is first
short_description: Byton plans to launch the European M-Byte EV initially in Switzerland, Germany, Norway, France, Netherlands, and Sweden. Pre-ordering in Europe starts in the second half of 2020 for €500.

title: Tesla Model 3 Performance with track upgrades breaks new record at Buttonwillow racetrack
short_description: A Tesla Model 3 Performance modified by Unplugged Performance managed to break the record for the fastest lap by a Tesla vehicle on the Buttonwillow racetrack.

title: Toyota will build an EV plant in Tianjin, China, in 2020
short_description: Toyota might be down on EVs for America. But the Japanese automaker announced plans late last week that it will build a new electric vehicle plant in cooperation with the First Automobile Works (FAW) in Tianjin, China. The two companies will invest about $1.22 billion in the project. The plant is expected to produce 200,000 battery-only, plug-in hybrid and fuel-cell vehicles every year. The company did not indicate how many units would be electric, plug-in hybrid, or fuel cell.

title: Tesla officially starts offering $2,500 infotainment upgrade
short_description: Tesla is officially starting to offer an infotainment upgrade (MCU1 to MCU2 upgrade) to owners of older Model S and Model X vehicles.

title: Tesla launches $5,500 ‘Model 3 Track Package’ with new wheels, brakes and more
short_description: Tesla has launched a new $5,500 “Model 3 Track Package,” which is a new hardware package for Model 3 Performance vehicles with new wheels, brakes, and more.

title: Tesla explains the differences in its growing S3XY electric car lineup in one chart
short_description: Electrek obtained a new chart that Tesla is using to explain all the differences in its growing S3XY electric car lineup as it expands with Model Y.

title: Ford Mustang Mach-E is up to 41k reservations, with some in all 50 states
short_description: Ford’s Mustang Mach-E reservations are moving along nicely, with the car’s release coming at the end of this year.  We learned today that, if reservation numbers are sequential (and they seem to be), the car now has approximately 41,400 reservations (globally) according to forum posts. Also, according to Ford, there have been Mach-E reservations in all 50 US states so far.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: March 2, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/03/Quick-Charge-3.2.20.mp3

title: Porsche says 911 will never be electric – how much you want to bet?
short_description: Porsche CEO Oliver Blume says that 911 will never be electric, but he also admits that they “can’t stop” the electric revolution. How much you want to bet that they are going to change their mind on the 911?

title: Hyundai starts producing Kona Electric at Czech plant, helping triple its EVs for Europe
short_description: Hyundai announced that it will begin making the Kona Electric crossover at its manufacturing plant in the Nosovice, Czech Republic, this month. The plant plans to produce 30,000 units of the Kona Electric per year. That increase will allow Hyundai to triple sales of zero-emission vehicles in Europe, thereby reducing wait times.

title: VW chief adjusts goal from ‘overtaking’ Tesla to ‘keep as close as possible’
short_description: In a profile of VW CEO Herbert Diess, the Financial Times reports today that the German automaker has enough supply of EV batteries for 1 million EVs through 2023. He said profitability will begin with its first electric SUV. Despite headwinds, the Volkswagen chief says it’s prepared to deliver on its EV promises to become a “fast-follower” behind Tesla’s lead.

title: EGEB: US Interior Department official falsified climate-policy reports
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  An Interior Dept official falsified reports with climate-denial language. EPA chief Andrew Wheeler defends the proposed slashing of his department’s budget. After complete destruction by Hurricane Dorian, the Bahamas rebuilds its power grid with solar.

title: Tesla Cybertruck is already boosting sales, keeping momentum without tax credit
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck is not coming to market until next year, but sources at Tesla are telling Electrek that the electric pickup is already boosting sales and helping Tesla keeps its momentum in the US without the tax credit.

title: Leaked photos of new all-electric Fiat 500e reveal a bolder, cleaner design
short_description: The new all-electric Fiat 500e was set to debut this week at the Geneva Motor Show, which has been canceled due to the coronavirus. In the confusion, leaked images of the new, stylish, urban Centoventi EV emerged on the web. The shots reveal the third-generation as bolder, cleaner, and less retro than its predecessor. The photos of the fully retractable roof are especially inviting.

title: First electric VTOL Lilium Jet prototype goes up in flames: Updated
short_description: The first prototype of the Lilium Jet eVTOL aircraft out of two was destroyed in a fire. It will be replaced by the only one left in the flight-test program.

title: Tesla to deploy more functionality quicker after Autopilot core rewrite coming soon, says Elon Musk
short_description: Tesla is going to deploy more Autopilot functionality quicker after a core rewrite of its system, which is coming soon, according to CEO Elon Musk.

title: Top 5 reasons why electric mountain bikes actually make great commuter bikes
short_description: Electric mountain bikes are usually designed for winding around dirt paths and climbing steep mountain trails. And they’re great at that, but they can do so much more. That they can make perfect commuter bikes too, and often perform better than your typical comfort or city bikes. Here are my top 5 reasons why.

title: Tesla Model Y interior photos and video — USB-C rear plugs, 12v outlet in trunk
short_description: We haven’t seen much of the Model Y interior, and have assumed it would mostly look like the Model 3, just a bit bigger. But we have seen that the third-row seats aren’t very large, at least in prototype form. But now that cars are shipping from the factory, we’re starting to see photos and video of the Model Y interior, including more charging options for devices than on the Model 3.

title: Another Tesla fan gets creative with Model Y height comparisons — to S, 3, X, and himself
short_description: The Model Y will be in customer hands later this month (hey, first time we can say that), yet there are still questions over just how big it is.  We’ve seen a lot of photos and videos of the Model Y next to other vehicles, but still don’t have official specs from Tesla. One fan resorted to using his water bottle to measure ground clearance. And now we’ve got another new method of height comparison — using the “Jayscale” by Twitter user jayzilla711.

title: Another Tesla fan gets creative with Model Y height comparisons – to S, 3, X, and himself
short_description: The Model Y will be in customer hands later this month (hey, first time we can say that), yet there are still questions over just how big it is.  We’ve seen a lot of photos and videos of the Model Y next to other vehicles, but still don’t have official specs from Tesla.  One fan resorted to using his water bottle to measure ground clearance. And now we’ve got another new method of height comparison – using the “Jayscale” by twitter user jayzilla711.

title: Tesla starts shipping Model Y truckloads out of the factory
short_description: Tesla is starting to ship Model Y electric SUVs by the truckload out of its factory in California ahead of the start of deliveries in a few weeks.

title: Jeep’s powerful electric bike goes on sale today, but good luck paying for it
short_description: Jeep is the latest car company trying to cash in on booming electric bicycle sales by bringing a Jeep e-bike to market. The company has just announced that pre-orders are going live today for the Jeep electric bicycle. But wait until you see the price.

title: Tesla Model Y: first look at early electric SUV shows impressive fit and finish
short_description: We now get a close look at a Tesla Model Y production-intent unit and it shows an impressive fit and finish.

title: Tesla has finished clearing trees at Giga Berlin site
short_description: After about two total weeks of work, the forest of planted trees on Tesla’s Giga Berlin site is now gone.  Tesla finished “phase 1” of their forest clearance project this week, just before their early March deadline.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: February 29, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Quick-Charge-2.29.20.mp3

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: The EPA rolls back greenhouse-gas-leak prevention rule
short_description: The EPA rolls back yet another climate-protecting rule — this time it’s deregulating HFCs. Here’s why every Uber/Lyft trip should be electric and pooled asap. Paris Agreement architect Christiana Figueres explains why there’s hope — and why protest is vital. And more…

title: 28 MPH Juiced Scorpion moped-style electric bike begins deliveries
short_description: Late last year Juiced Bikes unveiled its latest electric bike model, the Juiced Scorpion. The dual suspension, moped-style bike was pre-sold via an Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign. And nearly six months to the day after the Scorpion was first announced, it is now showing up in the driveways and garages of the first early adopters.

title: Tesla spotted stockpiling some brand new Model Y SUVs at factory
short_description: Tesla has been spotted stockpiling some brand new Model Y SUVs in the parking lot of its factory ahead of the start of deliveries next month.

title: Classic Ford Bronco goes electric for $185,000
short_description: The Ford Bronco is a fan favorite for restoration in the US and now there’s an all-electric steel version of it going for sale starting at $185,000.

title: Ford struggles with investors just as it prepares to launch EVs
short_description: Shares of Ford hit an 11-year low this week. Newly appointed Ford COO Jim Farley said the company has a “sense of urgency and crisis” on Wednesday at a conference for investors in New York. The big question is if these challenges, and the need for higher near-term profit margins, will affect the company’s EV plans.

title: Podcast: Tesla secret Roadrunner project, Model Y delivery confirmation, Chevy Menlo EV, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including Tesla’s secret Roadrunner project, Model Y delivery confirmations, the Chevy Menlo EV, and more.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Electrek-02-29-2020.mp3

title: Coronavirus forces shutdown of Geneva Motor Show, but BMW i4 and other EVs will be unveiled online
short_description: Geneva Motor Show decided to cancel this year’s event because of the coronavirus, but we are still going to see a few of the electric cars that were going to be unveiled at the show.

title: Cleveland Cyclewerks’ upcoming electric motorcycle to reach 85 MPH
short_description: Cleveland Cyclewerks, a gas-powered motorcycle manufacturer, will be unveiling its first-ever electric motorcycle next month. Tech specs had been few and far between until recently when the company spilled the beans and shared a number of impressive specs for the bike.

title: Audi unveils new e-tron S, claims will be ‘first electric cars worldwide with three motors in mass production’
short_description: Audi is unveiling its new e-tron S models and the company claims that they will be “the first electric cars worldwide with three motors in mass production.”

title: January EV sales in Europe gives hope automakers will meet 2020 EU emission targets
short_description: International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) today reports that there’s a “good chance” that vehicle manufacturers will be able to meet their 2020/21 CO2 targets in time to avoid paying any penalties. The new optimism is based on incoming January 2020 data. In one shining example, the average CO2 level of new cars in France dropped from 113 g/km in December to 96 g/km in January, a 15% improvement in a single month.

title: DC’s electric vehicle charging law will have residents paying double to triple
short_description: Washington, DC, has proposed a regulation that will govern electric vehicle (EV) charging on public streets. The contrast with surrounding Maryland neighborhoods shows how forgoing utility-operated and regulated-charging costs residents dearly.

title: With Tesla deal set, Chinese battery maker CATL makes plans to quadruple output
short_description: The world’s biggest electric vehicle battery maker, CATL, will invest up to $3.7 billion to quadruple its production capacity for lithium-ion batteries used in cars and storage systems. In today’s report from Japan’s Nikkei, the financial publication tied CATL’s announcement with its plans to supply batteries to Tesla.

title: Which is cuter, the Microlino electric bubble car or its electric scooter companion?
short_description: The bubble car is back, thanks to the upcoming all-electric Microlino. And now we’re getting word that the adorable little EV is getting a fun little electric scooter sidekick as well.

title: EGEB: UK’s National Express to cease buying diesel buses
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  National Express intends to become the first zero-emission transport group in the UK. As West Virginia’s legislature passes a solar bill, there are plans to turn coalfields into solar farms. The DOE was sued this week over its move to block requirements for more efficient light bulbs.

title: Citroën launches $6,000 electric car that a 14-year-old can drive
short_description: Citroën is launching the Ami, a new ~$6,000 mini electric car that can cost just $20 per month and it can be legally driven by a 14-year-old can in France.

title: Could motorbike noise regulations push more riders onto electric motorcycles?
short_description: Loud motorcycles are becoming such a nuisance in much of Europe that laws against them are starting to be enacted.

title: Tesla could be worth $1.5 trillion by the end of the decade, says Ron Baron
short_description: Ron Baron, a billionaire stock investor and Tesla shareholder, says that Tesla could be worth $1.5 trillion by the end of the decade.

title: Report: Why Every Uber/Lyft trip should be electric and pooled asap
short_description: The Union of Concerned Scientists this week published a study comparing emissions from private car trips with journeys via Uber or Lyft. Researchers also looked at the broader impact of ride-hailing on other types of urban travel, including public transportation, biking, and walking. The top-level finding is that ride-hailing trips today result in an estimated 69% more climate pollution on average than the trips they displace. The solution? Electrify Uber and Lyft, and share rides on those services.

title: Tesla Cybertruck vs Ford F-150 tug-of-war rematch finally happens but with ‘small’ twist
short_description: The Tesla Cybertruck vs Ford F150 tug-of-war rematch finally happened, but neither Tesla or Ford were actually involved. Instead, a bunch of engineers put a half-scale Cybertruck versus the best-selling pickup.

title: BMW puts iNEXT electric car prototype through extreme heat test, battery pack ‘stands’ it
short_description: BMW is showing an iNEXT electric car prototype going through extreme heat tests ahead of the launch of the production version.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: February 27, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Quick-Charge-2.27.20.mp3

title: Tesla sales in China drop despite start of local production, people panic and TSLA crashes
short_description: Tesla’s sales in China have dropped significantly in the first month of the year despite Tesla starting local production and deliveries. The drop also happened before the ramp-up in fear over the coronavirus and now Tesla’s stock is taking a major hit.

title: eVTOL to be used as ambulances in the coronavirus crisis
short_description: It will take months to figure the extent of the catastrophic Coronavirus outbreak. To help fight off the Covid-19 epidemic, eHang is lending its eVTOL for medical relief.

title: Tesla reports fully autonomous miles for first time in years, but it’s nothing to get excited about
short_description: Tesla has reported some fully autonomous test miles for the first time in years in the California DMV disengagement report, but it’s nothing to get too excited about.

title: EGEB: Will Utah commit to a statewide EV charging network today?
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Utah legislature is considering a statewide electric-vehicle charging network bill. Ireland buys 600 more hybrid buses. Why not opt for fully electric? Seattle’s new NHL team will fully subsidize public transport for hockey fans.

title: Ireland buys 600 more hybrid buses. Why not opt for fully electric?
short_description: The Republic of Ireland’s National Transport Authority (NTA) is buying up to 600 hybrid double-decker buses from BAE and bus-building company Alexander Dennis Ltd.

title: Tesla’s massive 1GWh Megapack battery project with PG&E is approved
short_description: Tesla’s massive project to deploy 1GWh of Megapacks to create a giant energy storage system in California with PG&E has received approval from the local authorities.

title: Tesla Model Y ships in weeks, yet we’re measuring ground clearance with water bottles
short_description: The Tesla Model Y is shipping in just about two weeks, and it looks like Tesla has a lot of cars ready to sell. Early customers have been getting emails asking them to confirm deliveries, and the cars should be in customers’ hands soon. But we still don’t know how big it is. So, in the absence of specs, what are we to do?  Well, an enterprising fan and friend of the site saw a Model Y in public, didn’t have a measuring tape on hand, and got creative — with his water bottle.

title: Electrify America to deploy 30 off-grid, solar EV chargers in rural California communities
short_description: Electrify America, the Volkswagen subsidiary, announced today that it’s investing $2 million in solar-powered EV charging stations in rural California. The investment in charging stations that are not tied to the electrical grid will expand access to EV charging opportunities for drivers in rural areas.

title: Tesla tells Model Y RWD buyers to ‘prepare for delivery’
short_description: Tesla is starting to tell people who pre-ordered the Model Y Long Range RWD, a version not yet available to order, to “prepare for delivery” just a few days after confirming deliveries of the higher-end versions of the electric SUV.

title: Interview: Kia’s EV plans wait on battery supplies for at least another year
short_description: It’s been a couple of months since Kia’s South Korean headquarters released “Plan S,” the brand’s EV and mobility plan. That plan set a target of a half-million annual global EV sales by 2026 with a worldwide lineup of at least 11 all-electric models. Electrek checked in with Steve Kosowski, manager of long-range planning and strategy at Kia Motors America, to see where things stand for North America.

title: Aftermarket Tesla Model 3 aero 18-inch wheel covers turn to crowdfunding
short_description: A new Kickstarter project has just been launched to crowdfund a redesigned aero wheel cover for the base 18-inch Tesla Model 3 wheels. The Kickstarter claims improved curb rash resistance, aerodynamics, and aesthetics compared to the base wheel covers.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: February 26, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Quick-Charge-2.26.20.mp3

title: Tesla signs Supercharger deal with NJ Turnpike, pays for other EV charging too
short_description: Tesla has signed a deal with the New Jersey Turnpike Authority to massively expand its Tesla Supercharger presence at Turnpike Service Areas, as well as build utility infrastructure for non-Tesla charging stations.

title: Tesla’s secret Roadrunner project: new battery production at $100 per kWh on a massive scale
short_description: Electrek has learned more about Tesla’s secret project “Roadrunner”: applying “the machine that builds the machine” strategy to produce cheaper battery cells on a massive scale.

title: How to buy a Tesla in 2020: Everything you need to know
short_description: We talk a lot about electric cars here, Tesla chief among them. But since Tesla is different than other manufacturers in the way they market, sell, and deliver their cars, we thought it would be useful to answer the question of how to buy a Tesla in the first place, starting with how to test drive one.

title: Review: Dōst e-bikes tout 120 miles of comfort
short_description: A new Vancouver based e-bike company has created mid-priced electric comfort bikes capable of 120 miles of range. Dōst Bikes (rhymes with “coast”) has a simple solution to range anxiety; double the battery size. While it’s not the first dual-battery iteration we’ve seen, it’s the first time I’ve seen it on comfort commuters that maintain a wide variety of uses.

title: NIO starts production of its new EC6 electric SUV coupe
short_description: The production of the highly anticipated NIO EC6 SUV EV kicked off at the JAC-NIO Advanced Manufacturing Center in Hefei. NIO shows it is continuing its climb out of last year’s slump.

title: Tesla asks Model Y buyers to change configuration to get sooner delivery, hinting at high volume
short_description: Tesla has started asking some Model Y buyers to change their configuration in order to get their car delivery sooner — hinting at production volume being higher than the current demand for the configuration going into production.

title: Energica’s sales are booming, surpassing 2019 sales in first 2 months of 2020
short_description: Energica’s sales appear to be exploding this year, showing record growth for the Italian electric motorcycle company.

title: EGEB: Hey EV fans! Do you know how the electrical grid actually works?
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Ben Pearson of Roadster Tracker made a great video that explains how the electrical grid works. Norwegian fossil-fuel company Equinor has abandoned oil-drilling plans in the Great Australian Bight. The NFL’s Philadelphia Eagles wear their robust sustainability efforts on their (green) sleeves.

title: Tesla Sentry Mode helps solve hit and run on a stranger’s car
short_description: Tesla Sentry Mode doesn’t only help Tesla owners. The surveillance system has helped police solve a hit and run on another driver’s car near Denver.

title: Mercedes-Benz shares new pictures of EQA electric crossover in winter testing
short_description: Mercedes-Benz has shared new pictures of the EQA electric crossover in winter testing after transitioning it from a hatchback.

title: Tesla and Panasonic end solar deal at Gigafactory New York ahead of battery event
short_description: Several reports coming from Japan are announcing that Tesla and Panasonic are ending their solar cell production deal at Gigafactory New York ahead of Elon Musk holding an event at the factory.

title: CEO of Ford-backed Argo: Self-driving taxis won’t be purely electric for a while
short_description: It’s widely assumed that future autonomous vehicles will be purely electric. However, the CEO of Argo AI, the self-driving company primarily backed by Volkswagen and Ford, raised doubts today about the business case for robotaxis as absolutely all-electric from Day One. Bryan Salesky, Argo’s chief executive, conveyed his views while speaking with The Verge.

title: Volkswagen plans to hire an ‘aggressive’ internal climate activist
short_description: Volkswagen Group CEO Herbert Diess told the Financial Times that the company wants an in-house climate campaigner to fight for environmental initiatives. He said the candidate would be given access to top VW executives so the company stays on track with reducing emissions and producing electric vehicles.

title: ASX teams up with Spirit AeroSystems for affordable eVTOL UAM
short_description: Airspace Experience Technologies (ASX) is one of the ten Uber Elevate electric vertical takeoff & landing (eVTOL) partners. The company just signed a memorandum of understanding and a definitive agreement to cooperate with Spirit AeroSystems design. ASX moves closer to manufacturing what it says will be an affordable, certified eVTOL.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: February 25, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Quick-Charge-2.25.20.mp3

title: Tesla, and even Apple, get some blame for fatal crash on Autopilot, says NTSB
short_description: Tesla, and even Apple, are receiving some harsh criticism from the NTSB regarding a fatal crash on Autopilot in 2018.

title: Lucid chooses LG cylindrical cells, avoiding supply-constrained pouch cells causing industry delays
short_description: Lucid just announced the Dream Edition of the Lucid Air to be unveiled at the New York Auto Show (NYIAS) in April will be powered by the LG Chem cells. Cylindrical cells from the global battery supplier were selected due to their energy density and high availability.

title: Renault returns to old urban EV formula: Twingo minicar with tiny 22-kWh battery
short_description: Renault has sold nearly 4 million units of its gas-powered Twingo city car. That experience over nearly two decades taught the French automaker what makes a winning Euro-chic city car. Renault will try to leverage those insights with the all-electric Twingo ZE. The formula is urban maneuverability and a 22-kilowatt-hour battery pack that can fill up in an hour at a Level 2 charging station.

title: Drako GTE $1.2 million electric supercar: first ride and walkaround
short_description: Electrek had the opportunity to be amongst the first to get a ride and a walkaround of the Drako GTE, a new $1.25 million electric supercar coming out of Silicon Valley. Here is our report and video about this new EV:

title: EGEB: World’s largest EV — a mining truck — will be hydrogen-powered
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  South Africa’s Anglo American is developing the world’s largest hydrogen-powered mining truck. Bernie Sanders says he’ll make the fossil-fuel industry pay $3 trillion to fund the Green New Deal. A new Arizona law is a big blow for green energy and local governance.

title: BMW releases teaser image of i4, its first electric car with over 300 miles of range
short_description: BMW is about to unveil its next electric vehicle, the BMW i4, at the Geneva Motor Show next month and it is releasing today the first teaser image for the car.

title: GoTrax Xr Ultra review: The cheapest electric scooter I’d still put my friends on
short_description: Now that I’ve had a few weeks with the GoTrax Xr Ultra electric scooter, it’s time to share my thoughts on it. As one of the most affordable electric scooters on the market, this could be a great option for anyone on a budget. It of course makes compromises, like any budget electric scooter does, but the compromises still leave you with a nice ride for the price.

title: Polestar releases pictures of new electric sedan concept
short_description: Polestar, Volvo’s performance brand revived as an all-electric brand, has released pictures and a few details of a new electric sedan concept: the Polestar Precept.

title: Elon Musk’s Boring Company announces third-generation machine is working
short_description: Elon Musk’s Boring Company announced on Twitter that its third-generation boring machine, which is supposed to have had its ability greatly improved to dig tunnels fast and cheap, is now working.

title: Tesla starts confirming Model Y deliveries to customers
short_description: Tesla is starting to confirm Model Y deliveries to customers for next month after starting low-volume production in January.

title: Volkswagen hints at an electric sports car powered with performance-oriented batteries
short_description: The speculative list of Volkswagen electric cars keeps growing. The latest is a new all-electric sports car, as reported today by Autocar in the UK. In about five years, the first of a lineup of VW electric performance cars would borrow the “ID R” name from the company’s racing concept car.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: February 24, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Quick-Charge-2.24.20.mp3

title: Tesla under scrutiny again over fatal crash on Autopilot
short_description: Tesla is under scrutiny again over a fatal crash on Autopilot in 2018. ​The National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) announced that it is holding a public hearing tomorrow to “determine the probable cause of the fatal crash.”

title: Tesla is trying to change law that would make its electric semi truck popular in Europe
short_description: Tesla is reportedly trying to get approval for electric trucks to get around a Sunday and holiday ban for semi truck travel in Europe, which would give a significant boost to commercial electric trucks, like the Tesla Semi.

title: The last gas cars roll off GM’s Detroit-Hamtramck plant this week
short_description: Last Thursday, the body of the last Chevrolet Impala inched down the assembly line at GM’s Detroit-Hamtramck plant. Employees gathered around the car, snapping pictures of the final internal-combustion vehicle to be made at the storied Detroit plant. It will roll off the assembly line this week.

title: Tesla Model Y trunk pictures emerge – showing impressive cargo space
short_description: Several pictures of the Tesla Model Y trunk have emerged on social media – showing an impressive cargo space for the small electric SUV.

title: EGEB: Coronavirus crisis is resulting in a pollution drop in China, say analysts
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  Analysts are using pollution to gauge China’s industrial activity during the coronavirus crisis. Sheffield in the UK is installing smart sensors all over the city to reduce energy consumption. Germany and France team up on a floating offshore wind project.

title: Eyre to manufacture Pipistrel Alpha Electro in Australia
short_description: Pipistrel signed an MOU with Australian Eyre to There to manufacture their electric Alpha Electro in Australia.

title: GM launches Menlo electric car with 250 miles of range for just ~$23,000, but you probably can’t buy it
short_description: GM has now officially launched its new Menlo electric car with 250 miles of range and confirmed a starting price of just ~$23,000, but you can’t buy it unless you are in China. The new EV from the American automaker is sure to make some people jealous in other markets.

title: First sighting surfaces of Model Y with roof rack in advance of launch
short_description: The launch of the Model Y is imminent, but there’s still a lot we don’t know about the car. We’re still trying to figure out just how big it is, and we’ve got little information on what options will be available. One of those questions is around additional storage space for hauling large items, like roof racks and tow hitches. We’ve seen a Model Y with a tow hitch, and now it looks like Tesla has a Model Y prototype driving around the Bay Area with a roof rack as well.

title: Tesla Model 3 outsold all other EVs combined in California in 2019
short_description: The Tesla Model 3 extended its dominance over the California auto market last year, selling more cars than all other EVs combined in 2019, according to the California New Car Dealers Association.  In addition, when removing other Tesla models from the count, the Model 3 sold more than twice as many cars as all other manufacturers’ EVs combined. This made the Tesla Model 3 the third best-selling car overall in the state behind the Civic and Camry.  This result is a move up from fifth place last year.

title: Tesla Model 3 gets 350-mile in new ‘long range mode’ test
short_description: CEO Elon Musk congratulated the Tesla team after the Model 3 got 350 miles of range on a single charge in a new test on range mode.

title: Tesla Cybertruck with laser blade lights shows up at esports Dota 2 game event
short_description: The Tesla Cybertruck prototype was used to shuttle players into a gaming competition today, and we got a good look at the “upper laser blade lights” which will come standard on the truck, as CEO Elon Musk announced yesterday. In addition, the truck showed up with its original headlight configuration from the unveiling – a full line of LEDs across the front of the truck.  This suggests that the headlights might be configurable with a more “standard” arrangement for driving on public roads and a full-array setting for off-roading (or, in this case, marketing exercises).

title: Quick Charge Podcast: February 22, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Quick-Charge-2.22.20.mp3

title: Porsche’s new ultra-powerful EV-charging park in Leipzig opens to the public
short_description: Porsche this week opened a showcase of the EV-charging future at its plant in Leipzig, Germany. The facility has 12 350-kW DC fast-chargers and 4 22-kW AC chargers. The total capacity is 7 megawatts, making it Europe’s most powerful rapid-charge park, according to Porsche. EV drivers, regardless of vehicle brand, can use the facility free of charge through March – before a standard charging plan takes effect.

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: How emissions and pollution damage children’s health
short_description: The Lancet and the Union of Concerned Scientists flag up how climate change is hurting children. This search engine is not only secure, it also supports ocean cleanup and emissions reduction. Why all media outlets need to follow the Guardian‘s lead and drop fossil-fuel advertising. And more…

title: Tesla Cybertruck will have high-tech interface to make towing better than ever
short_description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is on a roll with more announcements about the Cybertruck today.  He described a “towing calculator” which will show all kinds of real-time stats to help drivers know more about what their vehicle can handle while pulling a big load.

title: Elon Musk: Tesla Cybertruck will come standard with ‘laser blade lights’, be ~82″ wide
short_description: Elon Musk made some new comments about the production version of the Tesla Cybertruck, which he says will come standard with “laser blade lights” and be ~82″ wide.

title: Journal of Energy Storage studies EV owner’s manuals, compiles best practices for batteries
short_description: Researchers at the University of Michigan this week published a paper entitled, “Strategies to limit degradation and maximize Li-ion battery service lifetime.” The goal was to examine the best strategies for extending battery life, including for EV batteries. In the project, which was conducted in cooperation with the Responsible Battery Coalition, an industry association, researchers compared the owner’s manuals for electric cars with academic research.

title: Podcast: Tesla 110 kWh battery pack, LFP batteries, Porsche Taycan fire, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including a Tesla 110 kWh battery pack, Tesla possibly using LFP batteries, a Porsche Taycan fire, and more.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Electrek-02-21-2020.mp3

title: Report: At current rate of EV deployment, automakers not expected to meet EU CO2 targets
short_description: The world’s biggest gains in EV sales this year are expected in Europe. That’s because automakers face hefty fines if they don’t meet fleet-average CO2 emissions that increased in 2020 and continue a steep rise in the coming years. A new report from PA Consulting, a global consulting firm, shows that Europe’s 13 top auto manufacturers will face more than €14.5 billion in fines. Electric-car sales are increasing but not fast enough.

title: Audi suspends e-tron electric SUV production due to supply problems, batteries are suspected
short_description: Audi confirmed that it is temporarily suspending production of its e-tron electric SUV due to supply problems. Battery cell supply issues are suspected.

title: Tesla partners with Hot Wheels on Cybertruck remote-controlled toys, pre-orders open
short_description: Tesla and Hot Wheels have partnered to bring on remote-controlled versions of the Cybertruck, and they will come to market before the real thing.

title: EGEB: Fossil-fuel investor JP Morgan warns of ‘catastrophic’ climate change
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  A report sent out by JP Morgan to clients says climate-change inaction could be catastrophic. The Farmers for a Sustainable Future coalition has been formed by 21 agricultural groups. EV software solutions provider Electriphi signs with the largest fleet of e-school buses in North America.

title: Suzuki, last of Big Four Japanese motorcycle makers, to finally go electric
short_description: All indications are that Suzuki is prepping itself to debut its first electric two-wheeler, following the likes of the other major Japanese motorcycle makers. However, it’s not exactly what we were expecting.

title: Tesla Cybertruck is turned into police vehicle by Ontario police
short_description: The Ontario Provincial Police already released a concept of a Telsa Model X police vehicle, but now they are conceptualizing a Tesla Cybertruck electric pickup as a police patrol car.

title: Tesla partners with solar firm and Atlassian founder to quickly deploy energy systems to help bushfire communities
short_description: Tesla is partnering with a solar firm and Atlassian founder Mike Cannon-Brookes to quickly deploy energy systems in order to help the communities affected by the devastating wildfires in Australia.

title: Switch motorcycles unveils retro-futuristic eSCRAMBLER electric motorcycle
short_description: New Zealand native Matthew Waddick knows a thing or two about retro-inspired electric motorcycles. In 2018 we covered his work developing and bringing to market an electric conversion kit for the classic Honda Cub moped. Now he’s back with a new electric motorcycle company, Switch Motorcycles, and a decidedly impressive electric motorcycle known as the eSCRAMBLER.

title: Tesla rises 8 spots in Consumer Reports brand ranking, Model 3 gets “top pick”
short_description: Tesla rose eight spots in Consumer Reports‘ new car brand rankings, the largest rise of any brand, to become the top US brand at 11th place out of 33. This is largely due to improved reliability with the Model 3 and Model S. The Tesla Model 3 also gained Consumer Reports‘ “Top Pick” designation as the best electric car, according to the publication.

title: Xpeng’s second EV P7 wraps up performance test under icy -30º
short_description: You could see a furiously driven Xpeng Motors P7 on the Red River Valley Automotive Test Center in Heihe, China in February 2020 a few weeks ago. The next Xpeng EV has successfully finalized its icy weather performance testing.

title: German court lifts freeze on Giga Berlin building, forest clearing can resume
short_description: The Berlin Higher Administrative Court (OVG Berlin-Brandenburg) has dismissed complaints against Tesla’s European Gigafactory construction project, Giga Berlin.  This means work can resume in clearing the tree farm currently on the property.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: February 20, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Quick-Charge-2.20.20.2.mp3

title: Renault Zoe electric car sales surge, becoming one of the brand’s best-selling cars
short_description: Renault’s bet on the Zoe electric car is starting to pay off. Sales surged to almost 10,000 units in Europe last month and the vehicle is becoming one of the brand’s best-selling cars.

title: Investment rumors swirl as Chinese EV-maker Nio seeks financial help
short_description: Geely, the China carmaker behind Volvo, Polestar, and Lynk & Co, was rumored this week to be making a $300 million investment in Nio. Reports about the investment come from Yuguan Cheshi, a WeChat-based media outlet. That’s only the latest in a wave of rumors about how Nio will emerge from its financial woes.

title: The steampunk-lookin’ Newron EV-1 electric motorcycle is actually taking orders
short_description: Last year we ogled the Newron EV-1 electric motorcycle upon its debut, but questioned whether it would ever make it to market. As of today though, the company has ended speculation by opening pre-orders for the highly unique, wooden-bodied electric motorcycle.

title: GM enhances app for Chevy Bolt to use public chargers, but it’s a work in progress
short_description: The myChevrolet mobile app allows drivers to do things like remote starts, unlock doors, and gain access to vehicle data. The app’s Energy Assist feature for Bolt EV drivers has been available since 2017. But GM over the past few months has been enhancing its features, including the presentation of dynamic information about a public charger’s status. The company wants the myChevrolet app to become the only app a Bolt driver uses, but that might be a hard sell.

title: Tesla loses one of its most senior executives and Gigafactory builder
short_description: Electrek has learned that Tesla lost one of its most senior executives and the man behind the construction of Tesla’s Gigafactories, Kevin Kassekert, who left the automaker last week.

title: Top 5 affordable electric bicycles for 2020 (all under $999)
short_description: The results are in and electric bicycle sales are positively booming. Many electric bicycle companies are reporting record-breaking e-bike sales. But with electric bicycles ranging from budget e-bikes priced at a few hundred dollars to high-end brands costing many thousands of dollars, where does that leave budget-minded consumers that still want to find a quality e-bike? Here we’ve compiled 2020’s top five sub-$1,000 electric bicycles that we’ve tested so far.

title: Tesla firmware hints at integration of Powerwall and vehicle charging
short_description: Tesla’s latest firmware update hints at integrating Powerwall and vehicle charging for a more seamless home charging experience.

title: Proposed San Diego initiative would ban gas car sales over $50k, first in US
short_description: A ballot initiative has been proposed in San Diego that would serve to ban the sale of new gas vehicles costing over $50,000 starting next year. The initiative would also add a 2.5% tax on any gas vehicles over $50k that are purchased outside of the city and registered within city limits. A new organization called Breathe Free America has been formed to circulate the petition for the ballot initiative, which they’ve dubbed the “Clean Vehicle Initiative.”  They are looking to gather 76,000 signatures from San Diegans in order to get it on the ballot.

title: Tesla closes stock offering with $2.3 billion, stock price soars to $917
short_description: Tesla announced today that it closed its new $2 billion stock offering announced last week and the underwriters took the option to purchase an additional $300 million worth of shares.

title: Tesla is working on new ~110 kWh battery pack for more than 400 miles of range
short_description: Tesla is working on a new ~110 kWh battery pack, its largest yet, and it should bring the range of some of its electric vehicles to more than 400 miles on a single charge.

title: Quick Charge Podcast: February 19, 2020
short_description: Listen to a recap of the top stories of the day from Electrek. Quick Charge is available now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, TuneIn and our RSS feed for Overcast and other podcast players.  https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/02/Quick-Charge-2.19.20.2.mp3

title: Lucid shows progress at Arizona EV factory, new production Air picture emerges
short_description: If we haven’t heard from Lucid Motors over the past two years it was to get the company up and running perfectly. Since the beginning of the year, Lucid has announced a series of good news. The factory is on target to start production by the end of 2020. We also have a new picture of the final Dream Edition Air.

title: Tesla has a giant new building next to Giga Nevada and we might know what it’s for
short_description: Electrek has learned that Tesla is now operating a giant new building next to Gigafactory Nevada and we might know what the automaker is going to use it for.

title: Mercedes will quadruple the share of EVs and PHEVs in its 2020 EU sales
short_description: Last week, Daimler CEO Ola Källenius said “it will be a challenge” meeting 2020 and 2021 stricter emission targets in Europe. That left the question about how the maker of Mercedes-Benz vehicles would get below 95 g/km of CO2 (with 95% phase-in for 2020) to avoid paying steep fines. In an email to Electrek, a company spokesperson said it “plans to quadruple the share of plug-in hybrids and fully electric vehicles in total sales in 2020.”

title: Tesla Autopilot gets tricked into accelerating from 35 to 85 mph with modified speed limit sign
short_description: A group of hackers has managed to trick Tesla’s first-generation Autopilot into accelerating from 35 to 85 mph with a modified speed limit sign that humans would be able to read correctly.

title: Zero SR/S electric motorcycle unveiled with aerodynamic and comfort upgrades
short_description: Electrek was fortunate enough to attend today’s unveiling of the new Zero SR/S electric motorcycle in Manhattan. And we can confirm: The bike represents a bold new step by Zero Motorcycles in both form and function.

title: French startup proposes battery trailers as ad-hoc EV range extenders
short_description: If the 200-plus miles of range offered by a Renault Zoe EV aren’t enough for a long-distance trip, just latch on a 60kWh charging-on-the-go trailer in order to more than double its electric distance. That’s what EP Tender, a French startup, hopes that electric-car drivers will do with its proposed product. The company went back to the drawing board after offering internal-combustion charger-trailers for several years.

title: A fossil-fuel, ICE-car champion is tipped to be the EPA’s next chief of staff
short_description: Mandy Gunasekara, the self-proclaimed “chief architect of the withdrawal from the Paris Climate Accord,” is tipped to replace Ryan Jackson, the EPA’s chief of staff, who will step down on February 21. (Michael Molina will be acting chief of staff.) Jackson is to become the top lobbyist for the National Mining Association (yes, really).

title: EGEB: Local areas are buying electricity in bulk for residents
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):  More towns and cities are buying electricity in bulk — it’s called community choice aggregation. Startup Notpla makes edible, biodegradable pods for beverages and sauces that replace plastic. Fossil-fuel advocate Mandy Gunasekara is tipped to become the next EPA chief of staff.

title: Tesla reveals more details about Gigafactory Berlin
short_description: Tesla has revealed additional details about Gigafactory Berlin on a new landing page for the factory, including some details about sustainability as it runs to some delays over environmental issues.

title: This Italian 4 kW electric bicycle (or is it a dirt bike?) is heading to US
short_description: They may call it an electric bicycle, but the Italian-made SEM Moto-Bike is more like a mythical hybrid. It features the body of a bicycle and the heart of an electric dirt bike. And soon it will be headed to the US.

title: Tesla Cybertruck pre-orders reach half a million, tally suggests
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck pre-orders have reached over half a million since the unveiling last year, according to an unofficial tally updated by reservation holders.
