short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Former DOE secretary Rick Perry re-joins Energy Transfer LP’s general partner LE GP LLC.The NAACP is working with local and state branches to stop accepting fossil-fuel money.The world’s largest floating wind farm is now supplying power to Portugal.

title: Tesla to launch Model Y program in China at Model 3 delivery event with Elon Musk
short_description: Tesla is set to deliver the first made-in-China Model 3 vehicles to customers tomorrow, and CEO Elon Musk is reportedly going to be present to also launch the Model Y program at Gigafactory 3 in Shanghai.

title: Review: Build a DIY electric skateboard in 5 minutes with Revel kit (and discount code!)
short_description: Electric skateboards are fast, efficient, and thrilling ways to commute around town or just cruise for fun. And the Revel DIY electric skateboard kit helps you build your own e-skateboard with almost zero technical skills.If you can turn a screwdriver, you can build an electric skateboard with this kit.

title: Tesla Model 3 gets a gas engine hybrid conversion — creating the worst Tesla ever
short_description: A company in Austria believes that they can make the Tesla Model 3 “better and cheaper,” and they demonstrated their technology in a prototype by adding a two-cylinder petrol engine and removing some batteries in the Model 3 — creating the worst Tesla ever.

title: The 30 mph giant-wheeled electric scooter you couldn’t buy is now for sale
short_description: The Stator electric scooter, which is one of the most interesting designs we’ve seen for a standing electric scooter, is finally heading to market.

title: Fisker Ocean unveiled, $29,999 base w/credits, performance version 0-60 in 2.9s
short_description: Fisker is publicly showing their upcoming Ocean for the first time at CES, but held a private unveiling event today in LA.At the event, they went over various details of the car and announced its starting price. The car will start at $37,499, which after the federal tax credit means it will be under $30,000 in the US, and even lower in some areas with state or local incentives.Previously Fisker announced they will offer the car with a “flexible lease” for $379/month, which includes all maintenance.  Cars ordered today are expected to ship in 2022.

title: Are Gogoro’s doubling sales the beginning of the end for gas scooters?
short_description: Gogoro, the Taiwanese manufacturer of battery-swapping electric scooters, showed off huge growth in 2019. As the company prepares to expand globally in 2020, could this be the beginning of the end for gas-powered scooters?

title: CES 2020 EV Roundup: Nissan Ariya Concept, Fisker Ocean, plug-in Jeeps, and wild concepts
short_description: CES 2020 will not be the EV extravaganza that it’s been in past years. But we’re looking forward to seeing Nissan’s Ariya all-electric crossover, the Fisker Ocean, and a trio of plug-in hybrid Jeeps. Beyond that, we’ll get updates from Byton and Mercedes-Benz about their EVs coming in 2021. And because it’s CES, there will be all kinds of wacky concepts, including the configurable electric Fiat Centoventi, an i3 Urban Suite, and maybe even a couple of flying electric cars.

title: Tesla Model Y prototype spotted with new wheels
short_description: A new Tesla Model Y prototype was spotted with new wheels that might be aftermarket wheels – strange for a prototype?

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: Why is Australia being ravaged by fire?
short_description: Australian bushfires continue to blaze and the heat is relentless. Why is this happening?Angela Merkel’s New Year’s speech message: We must combat climate change. There is still time.The moment when climate activists Sir David Attenborough and Greta Thunberg “meet” on Skype.And more…

title: [Update: Orders open] Rad Power Bikes unveils new electric bicycle model
short_description: [Update: Pre-orders are now open for Rad Power Bikes’ new 2020 lineup, including the all-new RadRover Step Thru (seen below). Head on over to the Rad Power Bikes site to check them out!]Rad Power Bikes is one of the biggest names in electric bicycles. And with a pile of new announcements including a brand new model, it looks like Rad is set on maintaining its lead in 2020 and beyond.

title: Chevy Bolt sales decline for second straight year, a warning for Tesla competitors
short_description: It’s been a banner year for the Tesla Model 3. But US sales of every other EV stagnated or declined in 2019. New purchases of the Chevrolet Bolt, the nation’s second most popular electric vehicle, slid to 16,418 in 2019, a drop of 8.8% compared to last year. The 2019 figures represent a 29.5% decrease from two years ago. This winner-take-all paradigm, if it continues, spells trouble for GM, Volkswagen, Ford, and every other automaker trying to sell EVs.

title: Tesla has new glass technology for noise reduction, temperature control, and more
short_description: Tesla has applied for a patent on new glass technology for better noise reduction and temperature control inside its vehicles.

title: 56% of Norway’s new cars had a plug in 2019, Tesla Model 3 overall best-seller
short_description: Electric cars continue to dominate in Norway, as 2019 saw EV sales rise to 42.4%, up from 31.2% in 2018, according to OFV.  This represents almost a 1/3 increase in EV sales from year to year.Adding in plug-in hybrid sales, about 56% of Norway’s new car sales in 2019 had a plug.Sales numbers were buoyed by a record year for Tesla, whose Model 3 was the most popular car in Norway in 2019.

title: Podcast: Tesla’s Q4 delivery numbers, TSLA stock, Gigafactory 3, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including Tesla’s impressive Q4 delivery numbers, Tesla’s (TSLA) stock performance, Gigafactory 3 production, made-in-China Model 3 deliveries, and more.Support our show!https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2020/01/Electrek-01-03-2020.mp3

title: Tesla (TSLA) hits new all-time high of $450+ on impressive delivery numbers
short_description: Tesla’s stock (TSLA) is hitting new all-time highs of $450+ per share this morning after the automaker announced impressive delivery numbers for the fourth quarter.

title: Segway unveils 24 mph Wall-E style hoverchair for seated riders
short_description: Segway is on a serious roll with new personal electric vehicles lately. The latest is a hoverboard-style self-balancing motorized chair know as the S-Pod that is equal parts fascinating and dystopian.

title: EGEB: Oil prices jump after US kills Iranian general in airstrike
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Oil prices jump after US kills Iranian general Qassem Suleimani in an airstrike.Green energy overtakes fossil fuels in the UK in 2019 for the first time.Germany drops the cost of train travel in response to the climate crisis.Israel approved hundreds of wind turbines in the north of the country.

title: A new ‘Made in America’ electric motorcycle is making its debut
short_description: Cleveland Cyclewerks, an Ohio-based gas motorcycle manufacturer, has announced that it is getting into the electric motorcycle game.

title: Tesla destroys expectations, announces record deliveries of 112,000 cars
short_description: Tesla has announced its 2019 Q4 delivery and production numbers. The automaker delivered much higher than expected with record deliveries of 112,000 cars.

title: The well-endowed Curtiss Hades electric motorcycle gets a little more modesty
short_description: Above we can see the original design for the Hades electric motorcycle. That design, which we first reported on back in July, sent shockwaves (and grade school jokes) around the internet for its distinctive design.Now as the bike approaches its spring 2020 production goal, we’re seeing new updates to the design.

title: Tesla cuts price of made-in-China Model 3, now ~$43,000 after incentives
short_description: Tesla has announced a price cut on its new made-in-China Model 3, and it is now going to cost just 299,050 Chinese yuan (~$43,000 USD) after incentives.

title: Did a Nissan exec really just say that EV charging is too difficult for women?
short_description: Ivan Espinosa, Nissan’s global product strategist, wants to strengthen the ailing Nissan brand by “bringing more electrification.” For Espinosa, this means more hybrids and fewer EVs. And why is that? According to his interview published today in Automotive News, it’s because the location and weight of the charging cable make it too unwieldy, especially for women.

title: Ford’s dealership claims 100 orders for Mustang Mach-E in Tesla’s backyard
short_description: When Ford unveiled the all-electric Mustang Mach-E in November, it held the event next door to Tesla’s Southern California design center.Now a Ford dealership eight miles from Tesla’s Silicon Valley headquarters in Palo Alto, California, says it received 40 reservations that night — and is up to 100 orders.

title: Elon Musk’s Boring Company Las Vegas loop is under construction, going to be ready by year’s end
short_description: Elon Musk’s Boring Company is currently building a ‘loop’, its underground electric transport system, in Las Vegas and it could be ready by the end of the year.

title: In new year’s event, Hyundai promises 11 new dedicated EVs by 2025
short_description: Hyundai executive vice chairman Euisun Chung today kicked off 2020 by announcing an expanded output of electric vehicles and other advanced technologies. He said the group — which includes the Hyundai, Kia, and Genesis brands — will invest more than $87 billion to produce 23 EVs by 2025. However, details about a possible 11 new, dedicated electric vehicles remain murky.

title: Check out this Tesla powered 450 kW electric race car
short_description: What would happen if you took the power of a Tesla motor and stuffed it into a glorified go-kart? You’d get a crazy powerful electric race car just like this one!

title: EGEB: US government will green-light largest solar farm, more
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):A Nevada solar farm — set to be the country’s largest — will be approved by the BLM.Denmark sourced nearly half its power from wind in 2019.Danish energy company Ørsted has sold its liquid natural gas (LNG) unit.A new Stanford study says green energy would create 30 million jobs.

title: Tesla to start made-in-China Model 3 deliveries to customers on Jan 7
short_description: Tesla announced that they are going to start made-in-China Model 3 deliveries to customers at an event at Gigafactory 3 in Shanghai on January 7.

title: Tesla (TSLA) jumps as analyst hikes price to $515
short_description: Tesla’s stock (TSLA) jumped 2% when the market opened right after Canaccord Genuity increased its price target to $515 — a new high on Wall Street.

title: Tesla is working to open R&D office in Israel, report says
short_description: Tesla’s expansion in Israel apparently involves more than selling cars and energy storage products as a new report states that it is also working to open a research and development office in the country.

title: Watch: Segway electric motorcycle concept takes hot laps on the track
short_description: Segway recently announced a pair of new seated electric scooters to be unveiled at CES 2020 next week. And as an extra treat, they offered a “One more thing” teaser of an electric motorcycle concept known as the Segway Apex.

title: Tesla updates 2020 Supercharger map with new locations
short_description: Tesla has updated its Supercharger map for 2020 with a bunch of new locations and routes to be covered by the fast-charging network.

title: Tesla adds more Arctic Circle superchargers in 2020
short_description: Tesla will open eight superchargers in the northernmost regions of Norway, Sweden, and Finland.This area of the Arctic Circle was previously a bit short of superchargers, so this expansion will be a welcome addition for Tesla drivers in the northern regions of the Nordic countries. The new superchargers are located at crossroads.

title: Not so fast: BMW boss says no electric motorcycles for 5 years
short_description: If you thought BMW seemed like it was making a lot of electric motorcycle progress lately, think again.

title: EGEB: France, Thailand launch single-use plastic ban on New Year’s Day
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):France starts its ban of single-use plastics today.Thailand banned plastic bags in major stores today to reduce ocean waste.Western states push back on the DOE’s decision to not scrap incandescent light bulbs.

title: Elon Musk delivers New Year’s Teslas with help from his proud mom
short_description: In a heartwarming and impressive scene, Elon Musk, his mother, Maye Musk, and volunteers from the local Tesla Owners club helped deliver cars to hundreds of customers late into New Year’s Eve yesterday.Endearing moments were captured and posted to Twitter both by customers and Maye herself (pictured below).

title: As Gogoro expands globally, will its popular battery swap stations follow?
short_description: Gogoro is one of the global leaders in electric scooter innovation, despite not expanding outside of its native Taiwan. But as slick as its 90 km/h (55 mph) seated electric scooters are, the Gogoro battery swap stations are perhaps one of Gogoro’s most important innovations.

title: Starting in 2020, California low-income drivers get carpool-lane access via used EVs
short_description: A new California law going into effect in 2020 will encourage low-income motorists to buy an affordable used EV. On Jan. 1, qualifying solo drivers who buy a used electric car can gain access to carpool lanes. The stickers granting access were previously only available for those who bought more expensive new electric vehicles. The change is designed to address concerns that only wealthier people buying high-priced EVs can drive solo in the fast-moving high-occupancy-vehicle (HOV) lane.

title: Tesla Model 3 takes over the Netherlands with more than 11,000 deliveries this month
short_description: Tesla’s sales are surging in the Netherlands with over 11,000 Model 3 deliveries this month. The market is closing the year strong for electric car sales due to the end of an EV incentive.

title: Watch Tesla Model Y Performance road test on the highway
short_description: Tesla appears to be ramping up its Model Y test program as yet another prototype, this time a Model Y Performance, was spotted during a road test on the highway.

title: EGEB: The UK’s new Vauxhall Corsa E ad is full of hidden messages
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):The Vauxhall Corsa E goes on sale in the UK in early 2020, and its latest ad is full of surprises.Kansas emissions are at their lowest in four decades. Here’s why.A school district in British Columbia has reduced its emissions by 25% over the last five years.Must-read: ProPublica‘s investigative work about how oil companies avoid accountability.

title: Upgraded dual motor 1,000 W WideWheel Pro electric scooter debuts in the US
short_description: The WideWheel Pro electric scooter is the latest update to what was likely the most popular electric scooter of 2019. And fortunately for American riders, the WideWheel Pro was just unveiled in the US.

title: Tesla announces Gigafactory 3 is already producing ‘more than 1,000 Model 3/week’
short_description: Tesla executives have confirmed that Gigafactory 3 has already achieved its goal of producing “more than 1,000” Model 3 vehicles per week.

title: Turkey plans to produce electric vehicles with a $3.7 billion investment
short_description: Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdoğan last week unveiled a couple of all-electric vehicle prototypes that will launch TOGG, a new state-supported automotive enterprise. The first vehicle, a compact SUV, is expected by 2022. An investment of $3.7 billion will enable output of about 175,000 EVs a year. The all-electric SUV unveiled last week was designed by Italy’s Pininfarina.

title: This is why Tesla drivers need to keep their hands on the wheel on Autopilot
short_description: A Tesla Model 3 driver filmed himself crashing on Autopilot and it serves as a good reminder that Tesla drivers need to keep their hands on the wheel on Autopilot at all times.

title: The dream of electric-car sharing services died in 2019
short_description: The experiment to offer battery-electric vehicles by the day or hour is mostly done. Companies such as BlueIndy, Maven, and ShareNow pulled the plug in 2019. These companies, launched with enthusiasm just a couple of years ago, were based on the idea that urban consumers would be eager to access (rather than own) a zero-emissions vehicle for local travel. But the operational costs and complicated logistics outweighed the interest in fledgling services. Maybe people want a private EV after all.

title: Tesla delays some US deliveries to next year in end-of-year rush
short_description: Tesla is delaying some deliveries to next year in the US as part of their end-of-year rush to deliver all inventory, and it’s going to cost buyers $1,875.

title: Revel’s electric mopeds enter Miami as e-moped sharing continues to expand
short_description: Revel, the largest electric moped sharing company in the US, has just added Miami to its growing list of cities.

title: EGEB: Your top 5 favorite 2019 Electrek Green Energy Brief stories
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB), as the year comes to a close, here are your top 5 favorite EGEB stories of 2019. We start with the most popular.Solar that can deliver electricity at nightSolar cell breakthroughExxon scientist: “They knew” that fossil fuels would cause CO2 to rise“Treelon” MuskCaffeinated solar

title: Bentley hints at using solid-state EV batteries as ‘liberator’ of vehicle design
short_description: Nobody expects Bentley to be a major player for electric cars. But it’s fascinating to consider what the Volkswagen group’s ultra-luxe brand is thinking about its EV strategy. First, a future electric Bentley will use the group’s Premium Platform Electric (PPE) architecture. Even more intriguing, Bentley’s leadership is talking about how energy-dense, solid-state battery technology could help the brand redefine future vehicle design.

title: Ford Mustang Mach-E 1st Edition reservations are full, most people going for longer range
short_description: Ford confirmed that it has sold out its Mustang Mach-E First Edition reservations and the automaker revealed some of the most popular options.

title: Low interest rates boost US utilities’ green energy investments
short_description: US utility companies are borrowing big because interest rates are so low. Investors are keen to buy utility bonds because they offer safe and strong returns.So the bond cash — a record $90 billion in 2019 — is resulting in utility companies making more green energy investments.

title: Tesla batteries help power new solar water desalination plant in Africa
short_description: GivePower has deployed a new water desalination plant in Africa using Tesla batteries and solar power that is now providing clean water to thousands of people.

title: The 9 coolest electric motorcycles that debuted in 2019
short_description: Just as we predicted at the beginning of the year, 2019 turned out to be a huge year for electric motorcycles. Below you’ll find our top 9 picks for the coolest and most interesting electric motorcycles that debuted this year.

title: Tesla Gigafactory 1: Panasonic ready to ramp up battery production to 54 GWh
short_description: Panasonic has had difficulties ramping up production of battery cells at Gigafactory 1 to support Tesla, but the company now says that it would be able to ramp up battery production to 54 GWh.

title: Tesla starts made-in-China Model 3 deliveries — opens the floodgates
short_description: Tesla has officially started made-in-China Model 3 deliveries and delivered the first 15 units — opening the floodgates.

title: Mazda wrongly says long-range EVs are worse for CO2 than diesel cars
short_description: The first sales of the all-electric 2020 Mazda MX-30 crossover are expected in early 2020. It’s part of a wave of new EVs for Europe with a battery size considered behind the times in the US. But Mazda (and others) introducing electric cars in Europe believe that about 35.5 kilowatt-hours ­— enough for about 150 miles of range — is enough for customers and is better for the environment.

title: Elon Musk tells Tesla employees to ‘ignore stock price’ in leak email
short_description: In an email obtained by Electrek, CEO Elon Musk tells Tesla employees to “ignore stock price” as it soars to new highs in a market rally.

title: 5 things Tesla is bringing to market in 2020
short_description: 2019 was a big year for Tesla, with a significant increase in production and several new product launches. In 2020, Tesla is bringing to market some of those products and more.Here we look at 5 things Tesla is bringing to market in 2020:

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: Trump rolls back more than 80 environmental regulations
short_description: The Trump administration has dissolved more than 80 regulations protecting air, water, land, and health.Activists in South Korea build a “Christmas tree” out of cigarette butts in a call for a plastic ban.South Korea shuts down a second nuclear reactor.And more…

title: Tesla Cybertruck makes music video debut with Cyberquad co-star in new Travis Scott visual
short_description: Cybertruck is making its music video debut today in a visual released for a new song from high-profile hip-hop artist Travis Scott. The video also features Tesla’s prototype electric Cyberquad ATV that the company unveiled alongside the new electric pickup, as well as Musk’s “Not a flame thrower” from The Boring Company.While Cybertruck can be spotted parked throughout the new video, Travis Scott can be seen riding the Cyberquad ATV prototype in several scenes.Head below to check out the full video.

title: BMW’s wireless charging for electric motorcycles patent shows off clever trick
short_description: BMW’s latest electric motorcycle patent shows that the company is hard at work on wireless charging options. And they seem to have come up with a clever option.

title: Los Angeles considers making Uber and Lyft go all-electric
short_description: In November, Los Angeles-based clean technology leaders announced its Zero Emissions 2028 Roadmap 2.0. At the time, Mayor Eric Garcetti called for a 25% reduction in air pollution by 2028. Today the Financial Times is reporting that Los Angeles may now force Uber and Lyft to use electric cars.

title: Tesla patents data pipeline and deep learning system for autonomous driving
short_description: As Tesla is working toward deploying an autonomous driving system as soon as next year, the automaker is patenting a data pipeline and deep learning system that could help them develop it faster.

title: Get ready for more states to charge EV fees in 2020
short_description: Nearly half of US states impose fees on EV owners or will consider adding fees in 2020. The ill-conceived idea is to make up for gaps in roadway infrastructure investments usually derived from gasoline taxes. Expect these counter-productive fees to expand in the coming years as the EV market grows. Oregon and Utah are next.

title: Tesla Model 3 cars are overflowing in Gigafactory 3 parking lot
short_description: Tesla is about to deliver the first Model 3 cars made in China and when the floodgates open, there could be a lot of Model 3 vehicles coming out based on how the Gigafactory 3 parking lot is overflowing right now.

title: Kia will produce its sporty Imagine EV in 2021, but an $11,000 compact EV for Europe is elusive
short_description: Kia Europe will meet the challenge of new EU emissions limits by doubling its EV sales next year, according to Emilio Herrera, COO for Kia Europe. He confirmed that the Imagine high-riding electric sedan will go into production in 2021. But the biggest obstacle for EVs is still affordability and profitability, especially for an all-electric version of the subcompacts popular in Europe.

title: Podcast: Tesla Holiday Update, Self-Driving ‘Sneak Preview’, Rivian news, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including Tesla’s massive ‘Holiday Update’, the Full Self-Driving ‘Sneak Preview’, some big news from Rivian, and more.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2019/12/Electrek-12-27-2019.mp3

title: Sorry New York, no electric bikes or scooters for you after bill veto
short_description: Electric bicycle and e-scooter fans in New York had their hopes dashed after Governor Cuomo vetoed a bill set to legalize the two-wheeled EVs across the state.

title: Tesla announces start of made-in-China Model 3 deliveries on Monday
short_description: Tesla announced that it will start deliveries of its new made-in-China Model 3 vehicles on Monday after weeks of waiting for official sale approval.

title: Volkswagen accelerates electric car plans, now aims for 1.5 million EVs in 2025
short_description: Volkswagen, already one of the most aggressive automakers when it comes to electrification, announced that it is accelerating its electric car plans and now aims for 1.5 million electric vehicles in 2025.

title: Tesla confirms it secured $1.6 billion in financing for Gigafactory Shanghai
short_description: Tesla released a filing today confirming previous reports that it secured $1.6 billion in financing from Chinese banks in order to finance its growing operation in the world’s largest electric vehicle market.

title: Electric cars won’t kill jobs, they’ll create them in places like Rust-Belt Ohio
short_description: The global auto industry will need fewer employees in the future. That’s evident from the tens of thousands of jobs axed in 2019 for a host of reasons. The world’s manufacturing regions that survive (and thrive) in the 2020s will be the ones that embrace new technology. Rust-belt Ohio is emerging as a shining example of how EVs can become the savior – not the destroyer – of US auto-manufacturing jobs.

title: Tesla Model Y stunning prototype spotted with dual motor badge
short_description: A stunning new Tesla Model Y prototype has been spotted with a dual motor badge and the new Gemini wheel kit.

title: Honda CEO says ‘There will be no dramatic increase in EV demand’
short_description: Honda CEO Takahiro Hachigo wants to plot a new course for the Japanese automaker. He plans to simplify the product line, overhaul the production process, and re-align engineering resources to work on new technologies such as driver-assist features. However, EVs are not a priority. “I do not believe there will be a dramatic increase in demand for battery vehicles,” he told Automotive News this week.

title: Zero SR/F vs Tesla Model 3 electric drag race: The winner might surprise you!
short_description: Who do you think would win in an electric drag race showdown: A Zero SR/F electric motorcycle or a Tesla Model 3 Performance sedan?There’s no need to wonder since this very matchup was performed and you can see the winner in the video below.

title: VW unveils charging butler robot concept for electric cars
short_description: Volkswagen has unveiled a new concept for a charging butler robot that can charge electric vehicles in a parking garage using mobile battery packs.

title: Tesla patents new chemistry for better, longer-lasting and cheaper batteries
short_description: Tesla has made a lot of battery moves this year and it is closing the year by filing a patent on a new chemistry for better, longer-lasting and cheaper batteries.

title: See what’s underneath and inside the Porsche Taycan
short_description: The Porsche Taycan has just hit the roads in the US, and Porsche Club of America had a chance to do a video walkaround of Porsche’s new electric sports car.  The video features Vu Nguyen, Executive Director of the Porsche Club of America interviewing Lukas Kraemer, Porsche’s Complete Vehicle Manager for Taycan.The video covers a lot of topics and has some interesting insights and specs about the car, which we’ll get to point by point.

title: 10 craziest Tesla Sentry Mode/TeslaCam videos of the year
short_description: As a fun end-of-the-year post, I thought I’d post 10 of the craziest and most interesting Tesla Sentry Mode and TeslaCam videos of 2019.

title: Watch Rivian spin in place with ‘tank turn’ – best turning radius ever?
short_description: Rivian gave us a little Christmas present today by releasing real video of an awesome feature they’re calling “tank turn.”This feature allows the Rivian to turn literally on a dime – it can do a full 360º turn without moving at all.

title: California bans per-minute billing; Tesla Superchargers will need displays
short_description: On December 16, 2019, California’s Office of Administrative Law approved amendments to its Electric Vehicle Fueling Systems Specifications. Effective January 1, 2020, these new rules ban operators of electric vehicle charging stations from billing by the minute.This is a huge blow to Electrify America and EVgo. Both firms bill by the minute for EV charging, leaving drivers with sticker shock and feeling ripped off by the end of the session. Chargepoint will also be negatively affected, as many of their site-host partners choose to bill per minute. And while Tesla already bills by the kilowatt-hour, California will also be requiring charging stations to physically display “on their face” important information about electricity cost and delivery, a move that will put the most burden on Tesla’s Supercharger stations.

title: Tesla’s new update is all about keeping eyes on the road & hands on the wheel
short_description: Tesla’s new holiday software update is full of goodies for Tesla owners, but it also has another theme: It’s all about keeping your eyes on the road and your hands on the steering wheel.

title: EGEB: FTSE adds more fossil-fuel companies to its ‘ethical’ indices
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):FTSE adds more fossil-fuel companies to its “ethical” investment list, the FTSE4Good indices.YouTubers have successfully planted 20 million trees in less than two months w/ #TeamTrees.New Jersey awards 45 community solar projects to low- to moderate-income communities.

title: Electric Corvette breaks top speed record at 211.8 mph (340.85 km/h)
short_description: Genovation broke its own record with its all-electric Corvette supercar by achieving a top speed of 211.8 mph (340.85 km/h).

title: First look at Tesla’s ‘Full Self-Driving Sneak Preview’
short_description: Now that Tesla started pushing its holiday update to the fleet, we get our first look at what Elon Musk called Tesla’s “Full Self-Driving Sneak Preview.”

title: Review: 1.5 kW FREY CC full suspension electric commuter bike
short_description: It’s not every day that you see a full suspension electric commuter bike. Especially not one with the components and build quality of the FREY CC electric commuter bike.

title: Tesla launches a new in-car music studio as Christmas gift
short_description: With its holiday software update, Tesla has launched a new in-car music studio feature called “TRAX” for owners to create music in their cars.

title: Customers screwed out of Unicorn scooter to get free Unagi electric scooter
short_description: Earlier this month we reported on the demise of Unicorn, an electric scooter company that went out of business before delivering any of its promised electric scooters to paying customers.

title: Rivian files patent to autonomously transport kids, keep ’em inside, text you if things go wrong
short_description: Electric-truck startup Rivian continues to rake in 10-figure investments and mass-scale orders. That’s even before the company fully disclosed its plans for autonomy. And now a June patent application discovered by Teslarati reveals that Rivian vehicles could have a “Guardian” mode that transports passengers, including “a child user, a senior citizen user, or a mentally handicapped user,” while monitoring and preventing certain activities.

title: EVgo acquired by power generation and transmission firm LS Power
short_description: Power generation and transmission business LS Power Development, LLC, has signed a definitive agreement to acquire EVgo from its current owner, Vision Ridge Partners. EVgo is one of the leading private operators of electric vehicle charging stations in the United States.

title: GM pushes feds to approve Chevy Bolts with no steering wheel
short_description: It’s been nearly two years since GM provided images of a next-generation Bolt EV that lacks a steering wheel or pedals. All of a sudden, in the past couple weeks, top GM execs have been talking up its electric hatch as a self-driving platform. Now Reuters reports that CEO Mary Barra met last week with US Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao to discuss getting those robo-Bolts on the road.

title: Tesla releases ‘Camp Mode’ — making some happy campers
short_description: Tesla today released its highly anticipated “Camp Mode,” which enables Tesla owners to use their car’s systems, like lights and climate control, to power their camping setup.

title: Rad Power Bikes unveils new electric bicycle model, updates others
short_description: Rad Power Bikes is one of the biggest names in electric bicycles. And with a pile of new announcements including a brand new model, it looks like Rad is set on maintaining its lead in 2020 and beyond.

title: Rivian secures $1.3 billion funding from Tesla investor, Amazon, Ford, and more
short_description: Rivian has secured a massive $1.3 billion round of funding led by T. Rowe Price Associates, an important Tesla investor, and others.

title: EGEB: First fossil-fuel-free steel comes to North America; Detroit blast-furnace mill closes
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):SSAB Americas brings fossil-fuel-free steel to North America.US Steel will close its aging blast-furnace mill near Detroit as it pivots to electric mini-mills.Stanford professor’s study says going 100% green would pay for itself in seven years.

title: Tesla (TSLA) stock hits ‘funding secured’ $420 price as Elon Musk gets last laugh
short_description: Tesla’s stock (TSLA) has hit $420 per share, which is the “funding secured” that CEO Elon Musk wanted to use to take Tesla private, and eventually cost him millions of dollars in fines from the SEC.Now Musk gets the last laugh.

title: Tesla scores large order from taxi company in Germany
short_description: More taxi companies are starting to look at electric vehicles, and especially Tesla vehicles, not only to reduce emissions but also to reduce costs.Now a Düsseldorf taxi company announced that they ordered 50 Tesla Model 3 vehicles to update their fleet.

title: Here is every electric bicycle we reviewed in 2019
short_description: This year has seen a bumper crop of interesting, exciting, and sometimes oddball electric bicycles. And as 2019 comes to a close, we thought this would be a great chance to take a look back at a whole year filled with reviews of awesome electric bicycles.

title: Tesla releases massive new update with text message reading, Autopilot, and more
short_description: CEO Elon Musk wasn’t kidding about Tesla releasing an important holiday software update. The automaker started pushing the update today, and it’s a massive one, with new voice commands, text message reading, and new Autopilot visualizations.

title: Tesla (TSLA) stock is up as it secures $1.4 billion in loans for Gigafactory 3
short_description: Tesla’s stock (TSLA) is up more 1.5% in pre-market trading today after it was reported that the automaker secured $1.4 billion in loans from Chinese banks for Gigafactory 3 and its operations in China.

title: 2020 Ford Escape Plug-In will offer ‘30+’ miles of EV range, sell below $30,000 after incentives
short_description: A Ford dealer guide distributed this week revealed the starting price of the 2020 Ford Escape Plug-In Hybrid as $34,235, including destination. Ford says that the Escape Plug-in Hybrid will have “30-plus” miles of all-electric range. The Escape PHEV will compete for customers with the 2020 Toyota RAV4 Plug-in Hybrid, which is more powerful while providing 39 miles of EV range.

title: Tesla’s end-of-quarter push is ‘intense,’ trying to sell every single car
short_description: Tesla is currently in a very “intense” end-of-quarter delivery push during which it is trying to sell every single car they have in inventory. Reports from sale channels show that they might get close to that goal, but not without issues.

title: First US Porsche Taycan owner says car’s EPA range is highly conservative
short_description: Porsche has started deliveries of the Taycan in the US, just in time for Christmas. And the first US Taycan owner has given his first “drive report,” and it’s pretty much all positive.Of particular note, he states that the car’s 201-mile estimated EPA range, and commensurate low efficiency, is “conservative.”

title: 2020 Democratic candidates: where each stands on electric cars
short_description: The quest for the Democratic presidential nomination will heat up in 2020. So it’s a good time to look at what the leading candidates say about electric vehicles. We focus on the front-runners: Joe Biden, Pete Buttigieg, Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren, and Andrew Yang. Here’s a sampling of quotes and position statements. For fun, we share what we could find about the vehicle each candidate drives. EV fans, who gets your vote?

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: 5 eco-friendly holiday gift ideas, a billboard that eats smog, more
short_description: 5 eco-friendly holiday gift ideas for you last-minute shoppers.If we cut air pollution, then it could prevent depression in millions of people.A Dutch designer created a billboard in Mexico that actually eats smog.A solar-powered desalinization plant provides clean water to a Kenyan community.And more…

title: Tesla leaks code hinting at Model 3 100 kWh battery pack, Ludicrous mode, and more
short_description: Tesla leaked some code in recent software updates hinting at a possible Model 3 with a 100 kWh battery pack, Ludicrous mode, and more.

title: Tesla Trans-Canada Supercharger route goes live all at once — mostly V3 250 kW
short_description: Tesla has been working on a Trans-Canada Supercharger route for more than a year now, and today it finally went live, all at the same time.Even better, most of the locations have Tesla’s new 250 kW V3 Supercharger. These allow a Model 3 to add about 100 miles in seven minutes.

title: Tesla Trans-Canada Supercharger route goes live all at once – mostly V3 250kW
short_description: Tesla has been working on a Trans-Canada Supercharger route for more than a year now, and today it finally went live, all at the same time.Even better, most of the locations have Tesla’s new 250kW V3 Supercharger.  These allow a Model 3 to add about 100 miles in 7 minutes.

title: What if dealers got big bonuses for selling EVs? Europe is trying it
short_description: Imagine walking into a traditional car dealership and having the salesperson take you straight to the EVs. When you ask about the gas cars with lower price tags, the dealer explains that electric cars have a lower total cost, among many other benefits. Why is the dealership pushing electrics? Because it would get a big bonus for selling a vehicle with lower CO2 output. This is precisely what will happen at PSA, Nissan, and other dealerships in Europe starting in 2020.

title: EGEB: Nearly half of US homeowners want rooftop solar
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):US homeowners who want rooftop solar grew from 40% in 2016 to 46%.Mainland Spain achieves its very first coal-free day due to high winds.India’s green energy use is rising, and diesel and coal consumption is dropping.The Netherlands’ Groningen and Drenthe provinces welcome a fleet of 60 e-buses.

title: Podcast: TSLA stock in focus, Tesla Acceleration Boost, EV tax credit reform gets shut down, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including Tesla’s (TSLA) stock coming into focus after a rally, Tesla’s new ‘Acceleration Boost’, the EV tax credit reform getting shut down, and more.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2019/12/Electrek-12-20-2019.mp3

title: Tesla delivers 5,000 cars in November alone in China
short_description: Despite the anticipation of the first made-in-China deliveries, Tesla delivered 5,000 cars in November alone in China with imported inventory.

title: Tesla opens first Supercharger V3 in Europe
short_description: Tesla has opened the first Supercharger V3 in Europe with a new station in London – bringing 250 kW charging to the UK.

title: New Super73 electric motorbike to debut next month, and it’s ‘something big’
short_description: Super73 is known for its vintage-inspired electric bicycles, and now the company is teasing a new electric motorbike.

title: Tesla is making ‘DLCs for cars’ and it might just be the beginning
short_description: With its latest “Acceleration Boost,” Tesla is starting to sell features through software updates, sort of like “DLCs for cars,” and apparently, more are coming.

title: Tesla Cybertruck has new official outing at office party, joined by electric ATV and Roadster
short_description: The Tesla Cybertruck prototype has had its first new official public outing at Tesla’s holiday office party after the unveiling last month, and it was joined by the electric Cyberquad ATV and the next-gen Roadster.

title: Tesla full self-driving ‘sneak preview’ and more games coming in holiday update
short_description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted tonight that Tesla has a “holiday update” with a few special gifts in store.  The update includes a Tesla full self-driving “sneak preview” and popular indie video game Stardew Valley, among other things.The update should be out to Tesla’s early access system in “a few more days.”

title: Tesla Model 3 ‘Acceleration Boost’ tested: 0-60 in 3.8, more power and torque
short_description: Tesla’s “Acceleration Boost” upgrade for Dual Motor Model 3s went live yesterday, and we’ve already seen the results of one test showing that Tesla’s promised half-second improvement to 0-60 times seems roughly accurate.The results of this first test were posted to Reddit by user Wugz. Wugz also previously tested Tesla’s “5% performance boost” that went live in November.

title: Lucid Air reservation cost reduced to $1,000, production starts late 2020
short_description: Lucid Motors, an EV startup headed by former Tesla engineer Peter Rawlinson, has reduced the reservation price of its upcoming Lucid Air to $1,000. Lucid had previously started taking $2,500 deposits for the Air in 2017. Lucid also reiterated that production of the Air is on track for “late 2020.”Pre-orders are currently available in the US and Canada, and the reservation fee is fully refundable. Customers from elsewhere in the world can join Lucid’s “international interest” list.

title: Volkswagen ID3 has ‘massive’ software problems, as company begins year of EV introductions
short_description: Germany’s Manager Magazine reports today that Volkswagen is struggling with software problems for its ID3 all-electric car. According to the report, the ID3 will be built for months with an incomplete software architecture that could affect up to 20,000 electric cars. These units, intended for sales in Europe and not the US, will require a manual software update.

title: Tesla partners with EVgo to deploy Tesla connectors on their nationwide charging network
short_description: EVgo announced today that they are collaborating with Tesla to install their proprietary connector on their public charging stations nationwide.

title: New Ford and Rivian patents rethink pickup features in EV age
short_description: New patent applications are flowing for upcoming all-electric pickups. The future electric F-150’s front trunk can be accessed without opening the hood. The F-150 will have multiple battery-storage compartments, creating the possibility of individual motors for each wheel. The Rivian RT1’s tailgate has multiple hinges for greater flexibility, and an extra battery pack could be added to its cargo bed. All kinds of possibilities open up when you ditch the engine.

title: Tesla Model Y: Banged-up prototype makes it all the way to Florida
short_description: A Tesla Model Y prototype was spotted in Florida, the farthest we have seen one from Tesla’s home in California, and it looks pretty banged up.

title: EGEB: Here’s how green energy did in the $1.4T US spending bill
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):How did green energy fare in the new $1.4 trillion US year-end spending bill?Demand for natural gas industry is dropping in the US for three reasons.Lawrence, Kansas, plans to run on 100% green energy by 2050.New Jersey utility Atlantic City Electric proposes to expand its EV programs.

title: Electrek review: TRB1 AM is a big softie on the trails
short_description: Riding along the trail on a soft, confident electric bike is a very liberating feeling, and the TRB1 AM delivers exactly that. As a well-equipped bicycle, it instills a lot of confidence in sticky situations, and the added weight of the large electric system actually feels nice going downhill. Where was this bike hiding?

title: Piaggio’s latest EV isn’t a sexy Vespa, it’s an electric tuk-tuk
short_description: Piaggio has just unveiled its latest electric vehicle, and it’s no Vespa. This time it is the classic Piaggio Ape that is going electric as the new Ape E-City electric tuk-tuk.

title: Tesla Supercharger network reaches 15,000 chargers — still one of its best assets
short_description: Tesla’s Supercharger network has reached 15,000 chargers — a new milestone for what is still one of the automaker’s best assets.

title: Tesla completes 300th Supercharger Station in China, 1st V3 under construction
short_description: Tesla officially completed its 300th Supercharger Station in China and confirmed the first V3 Station in China is under construction. Last month we reported that Tesla is planning a massive charging infrastructure expansion in China ahead of the expected increase in vehicle sales due to volume production at Gigafactory 3…

title: 3 reasons why the US natural gas boom is fizzling out
short_description: Natural gas prices plummeted at the end of November due to a glut of supply. It’s also looking as though a warmer December is going to keep demand down.And finally, the fossil fuel is being increasingly banned in US cities and towns for environmental and safety reasons.

title: Lightning Strike electric motorcycle being delivered, plus new secret projects
short_description: After making a huge splash with the announcement of the most affordable electric sport bike in the US earlier this year, we haven’t heard much news from California-based Lightning Motorcycles. So I set out to discover what was going on with the Lightning Strike electric motorcycle.

title: Polestar 2 electric car gets 3,300 lbs towing capacity — beating Tesla Model 3
short_description: Volvo’s Polestar 2 is going to be one of the most interesting electric cars to hit the market in 2020, and it just got more interesting. The electric sedan is getting a 1,500 kg (3,300 lbs) towing capacity, beating the Tesla Model 3.

title: Elon Musk: Tesla MCU computer upgrade going to be $2,000, but don’t recommend it
short_description: Elon Musk has been promising to offer early Tesla owners a media computer upgrade to improve performance, but it has yet to happen.The CEO now says that it could still happen in the future and cost $2,000, but he doesn’t recommend it — raising some doubts.

title: Bosch unveils smart glasses giving e-bikers a futuristic heads-up display
short_description: Bosch has been pumping out new products into the e-bike market fairly regularly lately. But the latest news from Bosch isn’t an updated e-bike motor or battery system — it’s a pair of smart glasses offering a heads-up display (HUD).The HUD in the Bosch Smartglasses Light Drive, as the new system is called, could open up new possibilities for e-bike riders hoping to keep their eyes on the road.

title: Tesla launches $2,000 ‘Acceleration Boost’ for 3.9s 0-60 mph in Model 3 Dual Motor
short_description: Tesla has officially launched “Acceleration Boost,” a $2,000 over-the-air software upgrade that makes the 0 to 60 mph acceleration of the Model 3 Dual Motor Long Range go down to 3.9 seconds.

title: Spurned by Tesla, NVIDIA’s new Orin self-driving processor ups the game by 7x
short_description: NVIDIA has unveiled what they call the “world’s most advanced processor” for use in autonomous vehicles and robots.  The new NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Orin chip can perform 200 trillion operations per second, which is almost seven times as many as NVIDIA’s previous Xavier chip (30 trillion operations) and more than Tesla’s FSD Computer (144 trillion).

title: Tesla (TSLA) hits all-time high as it pushes for record quarter
short_description: Tesla’s stock (TSLA) hit a new all-time high today, closing at $393 per share, as the automaker is pushing for a record quarter.

title: Bob Murray paid for science denial instead of his coal workers’ wages as company went bankrupt
short_description: While his company spiraled into bankruptcy, Robert Murray spent tens of millions from the company coffers to pay himself, his successor, and several anti-science and anti-environment lobby groups, according to new court filings.This money was spent at the same time as Murray is asking courts to excuse his debts to his workers, in the form of pensions and healthcare plans.

title: Meet the Georgia Republican politician pushing hard for EVs
short_description: Tim Echols wants his fellow Republicans to wake up to the benefits of electric vehicles. Echols, a member of Georgia’s Public Service Commission, is not happy that his state quashed state-based EV tax credits in 2015. That led to a nearly 90% drop in the state’s electric-car registrations. And Echols tried unsuccessfully get Washington to extend federal EV tax credits. But he’s not giving up the battle.

title: EGEB: New York’s MTA deploys first all-electric bus fleet on 14th Street route
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):New York City has launched a fleet of 15 electric articulated buses in lower Manhattan.A satellite helped quantify methane emissions more accurately — and the results were surprising.A Florida developer builds the first LEED Zero Energy single-family home in the world.The “world’s most powerful offshore wind turbine” sends power to a Netherlands utility company.

title: Daimler first winner in Virginia’s massive V2G electric school bus procurement
short_description: In September, we reported on the tremendous news that Dominion Energy, an investor-owned utility operating in eight US states, would be buying a minimum of 1,050 V2G electric school buses over the next five years. The procurement would start with 50 school buses, then add 200 per year over five years.Now the winner of the first phase has been announced, and congratulations are in order for Daimler’s Thomas Built Buses, who will be supplying 50 of its C2 Jouley all-electric buses (pictured above).

title: Tesla leaks ‘Acceleration Boost’ upgrade
short_description: Tesla accidentally leaked a new ‘Acceleration Boost’ upgrade planned for existing vehicles in its customer fleet.

title: TeslaCam footage used by police to track truck driver who pushed Tesla off the road
short_description: Footage from a Model 3’s TeslaCam, Tesla’s integrated dashcam system, is being used by the police to track a truck driver who pushed the Model 3 and another vehicle off the road.

title: Make a DIY electric surfboard with this new conversion kit
short_description: A pair of entrepreneurs have developed a new conversion kit known as the Boost Surfing Fin that promises to help surfers spend less time paddling and more time surfing.

title: US extends tax credits for EV chargers, motorcycles, fuel cells, again retroactively
short_description: The US spending bill just agreed to last night includes extension of tax credits for home EV charger installations, electric motorcycles, and fuel-cell vehicles.These credits were previously extended through the end of 2017, though that time the extension was retroactive, as taxpayers didn’t know about the incentive during the incentive period. Now, those credits have been extended retroactively again — covering the last two years, since 2017. They’ve also been extended forward through the end of 2020.

title: Tesla finds workaround to lease cars in Connecticut, where car dealers/politicians are blocking sales
short_description: Tesla has found a workaround to start leasing cars out of its showroom in Connecticut, where car dealers and politicians have been blocking Tesla’s attempts to legally sell cars.

title: BMW iX3 2020 is going to have 74 kWh battery pack with ‘range of 273 miles’
short_description: The BMW iX3 is going to be the German premium automaker’s first next-gen electric vehicle. Today, BMW confirmed that the electric SUV, which is going into production next year, is going to have a 74 kWh battery pack with a WLTP range of 273 miles (440 km).

title: Review: Wing Freedom e-bike wins style points — and it works great, too!
short_description: I’m not saying looks are the most important thing for an e-bike. But when so many e-bikes offer similar top speeds, ranges, and other specs, a nice-looking design like the one offered by the Wing Freedom can help set an already good e-bike apart from the rest.And an affordable price doesn’t hurt either.

title: Tesla is looking into ways to make Model 3 more than 20% cheaper in China
short_description: Tesla is looking into ways to make its made-in-China Model 3 vehicles more than 20% less expensive in China, according to a new report.

title: Tesla Cybertruck’s bed accessible from 2nd row, making a great camping machine
short_description: We’ve learned a lot about the Tesla Cybertruck, but there are still a number of open questions. Tesla CEO Elon Musk went to Twitter to answer a few tonight, showing several ways that the Cybertruck could become an ultimate camping machine.In response to a fan, Musk stated that the Cybertruck’s heating and air conditioning system will work in the truck’s bed area when the cover is closed, that the bed should be accessible from second-row seating, and that the Cybertruck will likely have Tesla’s “bioweapon defense mode” air filtering system.

title: Canoo eschews traditional vehicle constraints, ditches EV battery enclosure
short_description: If an EV doesn’t need a conventional engine and transmission, then why does every electric car on the market pretty much look like a gas-powered vehicle? That’s the question being asked by Canoo, the EV company actively re-thinking vehicle design for a new age of shared and connected mobility. We spoke with Canoo’s powertrain chief, who told us that the Canoo doesn’t use a battery enclosure.

title: Automotive News predicts 2020 downturn in EV sales, despite coming wave of new electric cars
short_description: Dave Versical, chief of editorial operations for Automotive News, believes the 2020 outlook for electric vehicles is weak. In his commentary piece published yesterday, Versical reports that auto executives speaking with him privately are using terms like “carnage” and “Armageddon” to describe the EV sales landscape for 2020. Has somebody been breathing in exhaust fumes?

title: Tesla is nerfing Autopilot for Model S/X in Europe to comply with regulations
short_description: Tesla is warning Model S and Model X customers in Europe about a new software update that is reducing the capacity of its Autopilot features in order to comply with regulations.

title: EGEB: Bill Gates-backed solar startup attracts interest of 1,600 companies
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Solar startup Heliogen attracts interest of 1,600 companies, and targets the Middle East.Goldman Sachs CEO says governments must put a price on cost of carbon.An American science professor who observed at the Madrid climate summit shares what she saw.

title: Tesla is going to hide its ‘solar test house’ under canopies at Fremont factory
short_description: Tesla is building a “solar test house” at its Fremont factory, and it’s going to hide it under canopies, according to new building permit applications.

title: GM CEO: Yes to self-driving EVs, no to plug-in hybrids
short_description: GM was planning to introduce one or more new electric vehicles at CES next month. But the company said it failed to meet the deadline because of the United Automobile Workers’ (UAW) strike, according to Motortrend.The delay is not stopping GM CEO Mary Barra from making a push on autonomous vehicles (AVs) while nixing future plug-in hybrids. “All AVs should be EVs,” she said.

title: Tesla is going to deploy a big battery in Alaska to replace fossil-fuel plant
short_description: Tesla is going to deploy a big new battery energy storage system in Alaska, and it’s going to reduce the state’s reliance on fossil-fuel power plants.

title: Tesla and GM are not getting EV tax credit reform, Trump reportedly intervened
short_description: Tesla and GM are getting their hopes of an EV tax credit reform squashed as Donald Trump reportedly intervened and threaten to kill the bill if it gets to his desk.

title: Lime launches subscriptions for electric scooters, reducing cost for frequent users
short_description: Shared electric scooters such as those offered by Lime have proven to be a useful commuting tool for countless riders. And now Lime is sweetening the deal with a new subscription service called LimePass that is likely to further entice riders to make electric scooters a regular part of their transportation equation.

title: Tesla is now steadily producing and shipping made-in-China Model 3 out of Gigafactory 3
short_description: Drone footage confirms that Tesla is now steadily producing and shipping made-in-China Model 3 vehicles out of Gigafactory 3 in Shanghai.

title: Segway-Ninebot adds electric moped and seated electric scooter, teases e-motorcycle
short_description: Segway-Ninebot has been on a roll lately with product announcements as it expands into new transportation categories. The latest new Segway-Ninebot products in the spotlight are a fleet of electric mopeds, Vespa-style seated electric scooters, and even a tease of a Segway-Ninebot electric motorcycle.

title: Kona Electric will be first EV to Mt. Everest, but Indian EV sales are dismal
short_description: Hyundai Motor India today kicked off a drive of the Kona Electric to the base camp of Mt. Everest. The trip will cover 435 miles and reach an altitude of 17,000 feet. The Kona EV is the first electric car to reach this height at Mt. Everest. But the drive takes place against a backdrop of nearly non-existent EV sales in the world’s fourth-largest automotive market.

title: Harley-Davidson LiveWire electric motorcycles finish 15,000 km trip
short_description: The Harley-Davidson LiveWire electric motorcycle is a lot of things, but “long-range touring bike” probably isn’t the first one to come to mind. Or at least that was until Ewan McGregor and Charley Boorman shattered that notion with an epic road trip on a pair of LiveWire bikes.

title: EGEB: Congress rep introduces affordable American-made EV bill
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Rep. Jackie Speier (D-CA; above) introduces a bill to Congress that promotes American EVs.Bank OZK goes 100% solar in Arkansas.Morocco gets Africa’s first fully solar village.

title: Tesla (TSLA) close to all-time high on EV tax credit talk
short_description: Tesla’s stock (TSLA) is rising and getting close to its all-time high today after some news came out this weekend, including new hope for revamping the electric vehicle federal tax credit.

title: Nissan switches SUVs from diesel to plug-in hybrid in Europe
short_description: Nissan sales in Europe fell 24% so far this year. To help make a comeback and meet stricter efficiency rules, Nissan is revitalizing its European SUV lineup with plug-in hybrid versions of popular crossovers. Diesel versions are going away. Meanwhile, the new Leaf version for Japan gets a list of tech upgrades, including better EV navigation.

title: Tesla has one more vehicle to unveil from Elon Musk’s ‘Master Plan, Part Deux’
short_description: Elon Musk wrote a two-part “super-secret Master Plan” for Tesla that the company has been following fairly closely over the last 14 years.Tesla already unveiled almost all of the vehicles that Musk announced in the plan… except for one.

title: Americans get yet another seated electric scooter option with Italian import
short_description: Joining the ranks of a number of other European and Asian electric scooter companies currently entering the US, Italy’s Nito has announced that its own electric scooters are coming to America. According to the company, the Nito NES electric scooter is USA-bound.

title: Tesla Model 3 ‘price bump’ in Canada is still safe for $5000 rebate, but cutting it close
short_description: Tesla’s recent Model 3 price increase has put the only version of the popular electric car eligible for the $5,000 electric vehicle rebate in Canada over the price limit, but the rebate is still safe based on the rules.However, Tesla is starting to cut it close.

title: Tesla dashcam saves owner from turn signal ticket
short_description: A Tesla owner managed to get a $171 ticket dismissed after closely studying the footage from his integrated dashcam system inside his Model 3.

title: Model 3 for $33,000? Congress considers EV tax credit revamp to help Tesla, GM, and used EVs
short_description: Marie Sapirie of E&E’s Tax Notes group reports on some potential big developments for the US federal EV tax credit contained in a draft bill, the ‘‘Growing Renewable Energy and Efficiency Now Act of 2019’’ or ‘‘GREEN Act of 2019’’. The draft is being promoted by Congressman Mike Thompson (D-CA), a member of the powerful Ways & Means committee, which is the chief tax-writing committee in the US House of Representatives. That means this draft bill should be taken seriously. The bill is a potential huge win for Tesla and General Motors, for whom the existing credit has almost fully extinguished.

title: Tesla starts offering ‘anti-ice window treatment’ after some issues in winter
short_description: Tesla is starting to offer a new ‘anti-ice window treatment’ after owners have experienced some issues during the last winter.

title: Tesla Cybertruck now even gets its own garage: Cybunker
short_description: Tesla Cybertruck’s radical design is inspiring some very ambitious projects, including now a garage/bunker for the electric pickup truck.

title: Here’s how electric bicycles are being used to teach new e-motorcycle riders
short_description: Believe it or not, an unassuming little electric bicycle may just be a gateway drug into the fun, exciting and environmentally friendly world of electric motorcycles.

title: Tesla releases giant new home solar power system
short_description: Tesla has released a giant new version of its latest home solar system – a 15.4 kW solar system suitable for 4,000+ sq ft homes.

title: EV Items Holiday Sale: 20% off Tesla accessories incl light upgrade kit, Qi charger & more
short_description: For those looking to do any last minute holiday shopping, our friends over at EV Items have extended its holiday sale for Electrek readers with a special last minute 20% off all of its Tesla accessories using coupon code electrek. EV Items is also throwing in a free Starman Elon Musk air freshener with all orders and free shipping in North America for orders over $50 (if you hurry, you’ll still be able to get your order in time for Christmas).Get 20% off at EV Items now for a limited time with code electrekHead below for a look at some items from the holiday sale including the company’s interior LED light upgrade kit and its Qi charger inserts for your Model S, X, or Model 3.

title: 8 lessons about EV battery health from 6,300 electric cars
short_description: A persistent concern among some EV drivers is the long-term health of the battery. All batteries lose some storage capacity over time. But how might that degradation affect your driving range a few years down the line? To help answer that question, we can now look to Geotab, a leading telematics-fleet-management company with access to a lot of EVs. Lo and behold, the losses are minor.

title: Climate Crisis Weekly: Highlights from the UN climate change summit in Madrid
short_description: COP25: What was — and was not — achieved at the UN Climate Summit in Madrid.Climate activist Greta Thunberg is TIME’s 2019 Person of the Year.Why melting ice in the Arctic directly affects every one of us.Which US states cut their environmental agency budget and staff numbers? This map will tell you.And more…

title: Teslas charge faster than Taycan, due to Porsche’s low efficiency
short_description: One of the standout features of the Porsche Taycan is its incredible promised 350kW charge rate.  Tesla has updated its Model 3 to have a 250kW charge rate, which is available on Tesla’s V3 superchargers.At first glance, this looks like a loss for Tesla.  But it’s not.  Because of Porsche’s low efficiency, it turns out that almost every Tesla adds more range per minute at peak charge rate than the Taycan does – and some by a significant margin.

title: Watch Tesla electric ATV prototype silently crawl in rare footage
short_description: You can watch, but more importantly listen, to Tesla’s electric ATV prototype crawling in rare footage from the launch of the Cybertruck.

title: Mercedes EQC US deliveries delayed another year to 2021, to prioritize EU
short_description: Mercedes-Benz has once again delayed EQC deliveries, pushing them back by another year in the US, as a “strategic decision to first support the growing customer demand for the EQC in Europe.”Mercedes last delayed the EQC this February. It has just started deliveries in Europe in the last couple months.

title: Your Tesla could help you get cheaper insurance through data
short_description: Insurance runs on data, and electric cars have a lot of it. One firm in the UK is giving Tesla drivers cheaper insurance by tapping into the car’s systems to track driver mileage.This could expand into other telematics, offering drivers better rates in exchange for more snooping.

title: Tesla Cybertruck loved by non-truck owners, less so by truck owners, says survey
short_description: The recently revealed Tesla Cybertruck is running neck-and-neck in popularity with upcoming electric offerings from big-name truck brands GM and Ford, according to a survey from Autolist.The survey also included Rivian, which is similarly popular. Among people who have never owned a truck, all four brands fared roughly equally. Among current and former truck owners, GM and Ford had an advantage, with Rivian trailing closely and Tesla quite far behind.

title: EGEB: Tesla (surprise!) is the most eco-friendly car brand — study
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):A fuel economy study finds Tesla averages the most MPGe for midsize cars, large cars, and SUVs.Europe announces its own Green New Deal.US onshore wind capacity exceeds 100 gigawatts — and Texas is the leader.

title: New electric Mini has 110 miles of range, and I still want it
short_description: We should have seen this coming. It’s been no secret that the heavy-but-compact 2020 Mini Cooper SE electric hatchback has a 32.6-kilowatt-hour battery pack. And that the lenient WLTP cycle pegs the 2020 electric Mini’s range starting at about 146 miles. But Mini is nonetheless warning the web that the Mini Cooper SE will have an EPA rating of about 110 miles on a single charge.

title: Podcast: Tesla Cybertruck is a medium-duty truck, Tesla Solar Roof, Tesla Gigafactory 4 plan, and more
short_description: This week on the Electrek Podcast, we discuss the most popular news in the world of sustainable transport and energy, including the news that Tesla Cybertruck is actually a medium-duty truck, Tesla Solar Roof expansion, Tesla Gigafactory 4 plans, and more.Sponsored by EV Items: Get 20% off EV Items Tesla accessories incl. Qi console charger, Interior LED Light Upgrade & more w/ code Electrek.https://electrek.co/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2019/12/Electrek-Podcast-Tesla-Cybertruck-is-medium-duty-Tesla-Solar-Roof-Tesla-Gigafactory-4-plan-m.mp3

title: BMW commits to i3 electric car production until 2024
short_description: BMW has committed to keep producing its i3 electric car until 2024 even though the automaker is bringing its next-generation electric vehicles to market starting next year.

title: Gift guide 2019: The best electric bikes, e-scooters, and e-skateboards this year
short_description: Who doesn’t love a great electric bicycle, scooter, or skateboard? Not only do they make great commuter vehicles, but they’re a ton of fun too!

title: Tesla Cybertruck is a ‘medium-duty truck’ due to payload capacity, says Tesla in CARB filing
short_description: Tesla has been describing the Cybertruck as a pickup truck to compete with the Ford F-150 and other light-duty trucks, but now a new CARB filing from Tesla says that it will be a “medium-duty truck,” and therefore, it should have a gross vehicle weight rating over 8,501 pounds.

title: VW says it’s not launching ID.3 electric car in US because demand would be too low
short_description: VW disappointed many when they announced that their new next-gen electric car, the ID.3, will only be available in Europe. Now the CEO of VW US Scott Keogh explains why the electric car is not coming to the US.

title: Tesla increases price of Model 3 as federal tax credit ends
short_description: Tesla has slightly increased the prices of Model 3’s two least expensive versions in the US — just weeks before the end of the tax credit on Tesla’s vehicles.

title: Formula E debuts racing champion Lucas Di Grassi’s film, ‘The Race for Clean Air’
short_description: ABB FIA Formula E champion Lucas Di Grassi is a UN climate ambassador and electric mobility entrepreneur. He traveled to New Delhi, India, to learn more about the fight against air pollution. He then made a documentary about his experiences there, which Formula E debuted today.

title: Used EV batteries will power Mitsubishi’s electric-vehicle manufacturing plant
short_description: EV critics often cast doubt about waste associated with used electric-car batteries. What they overlook is recycling efforts as well as the second use of batteries for stationary energy storage. The latest of many projects to deploy used EV batteries in buildings was announced today by Mitsubishi.

title: Tesla Cybertruck: Here are some of the coolest mods and attachments
short_description: The Tesla Cybertruck has sparked the imagination of some really creative people who have designed some crazy looking mods for the electric pickup truck.Here are some of the coolest mods and attachments we have seen so far.

title: Watch Tesla launch Model Y prototype on test track in spy video
short_description: Tesla was spotted testing a Model Y prototype on its test track at the Fremont, California, factory in a new spy video that showed a launch from a standstill.

title: Why Europe will see the world’s biggest EV uptick in 2020
short_description: In Europe, sales of pure electric and plug-in hybrid passenger cars are expected to grow 35% in the first nine months of 2020, according to BloombergNEF. That’s a much faster rate than we’ll see in North America or China, the world’s biggest EV markets.

title: This $6 million electric fire engine is coming to the US
short_description: Electrification is taking over every segment of transportation and now even fire engines are going electric. The Menlo Park Fire District is looking to bring a $6 million electric fire engine to the US.

title: EGEB: UN chief — ‘We urgently need more businesses to back away from fossil fuels’
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):The UN chief tells governments to support business efforts to embrace green energy.Heavy-duty trucks and buses must go electric, says new report.Florida has begun to transition to electric school buses.Denmark will build artificial islands for wind farms.

title: Listen to VW’s just-released branded electric-car sound
short_description: Volkswagen released an audio file of the sound its ID3 EV will make. The sound, developed by composer Leslie Mandoki, will be used as an integral part of VW’s entire electric-vehicle brand.

title: Tesla Model Y production on track for 1,000 per week in mid-2020, analyst says after factory tour
short_description: An automotive analyst says that Tesla Model Y production is on track for 1,000 vehicles per week in mid-2020 after a Fremont factory tour.

title: Heavy-duty trucks and buses must go electric, says new report
short_description: The electrification of trucks and buses needs to be accelerated, says a new report released yesterday by the Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS).

title: Ferrari, if it is still around, will go electric after 2025, says current CEO
short_description: Ferrari has been reticent about going all-electric, but the brand’s CEO now says that they will eventually do it after 2025 – if they are still around…

title: Mercedes-Benz teases EQA electric car – moving from hatchback to crossover
short_description: At the launch of the new GLA, Mercedes-Benz released a new teaser image of the EQA, which was supposed t be a small electric hatchback, and announced that it will be based on the new GLA and therefore, more of a crossover.

title: Tesla Gigafactory 4 leaked plans reveal room for expansion
short_description: Leaked plans for Tesla Gigafactory 4 in Berlin reveals that the automaker is leaving room for expansion, and the design looks similar to Gigafactory 1 in Nevada.

title: Review: Swagtron’s $699 EB7 Plus electric bike is ready for the urban jungle
short_description: When it comes to folding electric bicycles used for last-mile commutes, many riders have conflicting goals. We want a bike that feels big enough to be comfortable, yet it still has to be small enough to not get in the way. And the new $699 Swagtron EB7 Plus folding e-bike might just fit into that sweet spot.

title: Tesla Model X vs. Ford F-150 Raptor tug-of-war hints at Cybertruck rematch
short_description: The result of a new tug-of-war between the Tesla Model X and Ford F-150 Raptor hints at what would happen in a possible rematch with the Tesla Cybertruck prototype.

title: Is Jeep’s Christian Meunier gung-ho for EVs, or a serial greenwasher?
short_description: Christian Meunier, Jeep’s global president, was in New Zealand this week making big EV promises. He told Australia’s WhichCar that Jeep will be “the greenest SUV brand in the world.” If his name sounds familiar, Meunier was at the helm of Infiniti this year from January to May 2019. In that role, he said the next wave of Infiniti vehicles would be either plug-in hybrid or pure EV.

title: Tesla Cybertruck had incredible reach and is dividing people, survey shows
short_description: A new survey shows that Tesla Cybertruck had an incredible reach throughout the US, and unsurprisingly, the electric pickup truck is dividing people.

title: Toyota plans potential fourth EV for Europe, a battery-electric minicar
short_description: The small Toyota Aygo, launched in 2014, is the company’s only car sold in Europe without a hybrid option. When a new version of the Aygo arrives, it could leapfrog a hybrid and take on a full, battery-electric powertrain.

title: Porsche Taycan Turbo only gets 201-mile EPA range, efficiency disappoints
short_description: The EPA released the official range of the Porsche Taycan Turbo and it only gets 201 miles of EPA-rated range – a lot less than the 280 miles of range originally announced.

title: How will GM fund its EVs? By launching bigger, gas-guzzling SUVs
short_description: GM controls about 70% of the large sport utility market in North America. Profit margins on large fuel-thirsty SUVs can be as high as 30%, or more than $15,000 a vehicle. The company yesterday unveiled bigger-than-ever new Chevrolet Tahoe and Suburban models, claiming that profits from the SUVs will fund its investment in electric cars.

title: Ford Dealership Mustang Mach E test shows they are not ready, full of Tesla and EV misinformation
short_description: A test of 15 Ford dealerships about their new Mustang Mach E electric car shows that they are not ready to sell the new electric crossover, and they still have a problem with electric vehicle misinformation.

title: EGEB: New Jersey towns back a pro-EV bill; 300 mayors support solar
short_description: In today’s Electrek Green Energy Brief (EGEB):Ten towns and one county in New Jersey passed resolutions in support of an electric vehicle bill.Climate activist Greta Thunberg is TIME’s 2019 Person of the Year.A coalition of 300 US mayors sign a letter calling for a solar future.The Onion‘s satirical take in 2014 on scientists and green energy showed serious foresight.

title: Porsche has already turned 10,000 Taycan reservations into orders
short_description: Porsche had been accumulating a lot of pre-orders for the Taycan even before the unveiling with the specs and pricing announcement, but now the automaker confirms that it has already turned 10,000 Taycan reservations into orders.

title: Climate activist Greta Thunberg is TIME’s 2019 Person of the Year
short_description: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg has been named as TIME magazine’s 2019 Person of the Year. Every year, TIME names the person who the magazine considers “for better or for worse… has done the most to influence the events of the year.”

title: Check out this new, modular electric skateboard that wants to change everything
short_description: Despite not being a very old industry, electric skateboards have seemed to settle into a stable, almost stagnant state of incremental updates instead of major innovations. Or at least that’s what I thought up until today when the new Dot modular electric skateboard came along and changed everything.

title: Tesla is in talks with police department to use Sentry Mode for policing needs
short_description: A police department in Connecticut bought a Tesla Model 3 and disclosed that they are “in direct conversations with Tesla” to use Sentry Mode for policing needs in Tesla police patrol cars.

title: Tesla and other EVs block gas station in protest against charging station Icing
short_description: Tesla vehicles and a few other electric vehicles blocked a gas station in Croatia in a protest organized by the local unofficial Tesla owners club against the lack of action to prevent EV charging stations being blocked by parked gas-powered cars, also known as Icing.

title: Gogoro’s popular 55 mph seated electric scooters are finally going global
